loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a ellos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Este distrito en considerado como el segundo distrito mas poblado de la región, pero también es considerado el distrito más pobre.

Consuelo posee una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros)  con la cual se gana la vida. El vehículo es manejado por su hijo mayor el cual cubre carreras dentro de su distrito y en sus anexos. El continuo uso del vehículo hace que sea necesario otorgarle mantenimiento constante, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Con el dinero del préstamo comprará además forros para los asientos y anillos para el motor. Su anhelo es poder juntar el dinero que le permita comprarse otra mototaxi de segunda mano.

Ella es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia, sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen bastante estima y la consideran una mujer luchadora que siempre trata de salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades
texts.en:
Consuelo, 38, is a single mother of two children. She lives with them in the José Leonardo Ortiz district, which is 5 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. This district is considered to be the second-most populated in the region but is is also considered to be the poorest. Consuelo has a mototaxi (motorized, three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) which is her source of income. Her oldest son is the mototaxi driver; he covers routes within her district and in outlying areas. The continuous use of the vehicle requires that it be serviced often. This is the reason behind her requesting, for the first time, funds in the amount of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She will use the funds to buy new seat covers and piston rings. Her dream is to be able to save enough money to buy another used mototaxi. She is a woman that is quite dedicated to her family. Her neighbors and acquaintances all hold her in high regard and consider her to be a hard-working woman who always does her best to get ahead despite any difficulty that arises.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For mototaxi repair and service.

loans.name: Arvie

texts.en:
Arvie A. is from the village of Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old. Arvie is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Arvie owns & operates a business selling bags and pouches in the local community. Arvie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 13,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arvie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arvie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arvie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Topi

texts.en: Topi is a 50-year-old widow with two children. They are aged between 16 and 20 years. Both her children go to school. She is also looking after three children for her deceased siblings. She owns a two-room house in which she lives with six people. There is no access to piped water or electricity. She works seven days a week in Kalerwe market outside Kampala, where she rents a space to sell bananas, vegetables and Irish potatoes, a trade she has handled for over 10 years. There is a market for her service and she serves all kinds of people. Her main challenge is the rainy season because she works in a muddy place. After being with MCDT for eight moths servicing her second loan, she has increased her business and income. She is hoping to see her business grow bigger and to start going directly to farmers.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou S. est âgée de 58 ans et habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est sociétaire de l’institution de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis novembre 2003. Elle est vendeuse de profession. Elle plus connue dans la vente de Bazin, de wax, de thioubs. Elle évolue dans ce domaine depuis plus de 20 ans. Son mari ne dispose pas d’assez de revenus pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. C’est la raison pour laquelle elle s’est adonné à cette activité génératrice de revenus. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus c’est réaliser beaucoup de profits. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour renforcer son stock. Son objectif est l’amélioration de sa situation sociale.
texts.en:
Mrs Aissatou S. is a 58 year-old married mother of one who lives in the Yoff region. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC organisation since November 2003, and is a saleswoman by trade, specialising in the sale of Bazin (a West African cloth), 'wax' fabric (colourful West African cloth) and thioubs (dyed cloth); she has been involved in this field for over 20 years. Her husband does not bring in enough money to cater for all the family's needs, and so Aissatou must work. She is most interested in generating large profits, and is seeking a 150 000 FRS loan in order to bolster her stock. Her ultimate aim is to improve her quality of life.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing business funding

texts.fr: Madame Ndieme D. Habite à Yoff  Ndeungagne. Elle est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est membre de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis novembre 2003. Elle a déjà bénéficié  de 2 prêts  antérieurs. Ainsi elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour l’achat  de marchandises. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité  et améliorer  la condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndieme D. lives in Yoff Ndeungagne. She is 31 years old and has been a member of the U-IMCEC Yoff branch office since November 2003. She has already benefited from two previous loans. She is married and the mother of four children, ranging from 6 months to 12 years of age. Ndieme has been progressing in the commerce of clothing and shoe since 2007. Motivated by her aunt, she opted for this work. Making a profit is the most interesting thing to her about it. And so, she is requesting a loan of 100,00 francs for buying merchandise. Her goal is to bolster her business and to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Melquiades

texts.es:
Melquíades tiene 48 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus abuelos y tíos. Adquirió 
su vehiculo con sus ahorros. Tiene amplia experiencia en el servicio que brinda, en la 
actualidad realiza el servicio de colectivo y taxi, en la época escolar realiza 
movilidad escolar, teniendo un ingreso adicional. Melquíades sueña con tener  mas de 
una unidad y así formar su propia empresa de vehículos las cuales brindarían el 
servicio en la ciudad. Èl solicita el crédito para realizarle mantenimiento a su 
vehiculo.
texts.en:
Melquíades is 48 years old, single, and lives in his grandparent's home with his aunts and uncles. He bought his car with his savings. He has lots of experience in his business, driving a taxicab. During the school year he drives student's to and from school for extra income. Melquíades dreams of having more than one vehicle. He would like to start his own car service that would cover the city. He is asking for a loan to service his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenence of work tool.

loans.name: Jakeline Katiuska

texts.es:
Las socias del  Banco Comunal Alianza  se reúnen en el sector Pachinche a unos 20 minutos de distancia de la ciudad de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manbí, conversamos con la señora Jakeline ella apenas tiene dos ciclos y esta muy contenta con el trabajo que viene realizando junto a la Fundación.

Jakeline es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos pequeños vive en el sector cuatro esquinas a las afueras de Portoviejo, con 28 años de edad se ha tenido que enfrentar  grandes desafíos como es el cuidado y mantención de sus hijos y para  ayudarse económicamente y no descuidar a sus niños ella tiene la venta de sabanas, cortinas, edredones y toldos de esta manera trabaja desde hace dos años,  recorre el sector visitando puerta a puerta a los clientes y deja a  crédito con facilidades de pagos la mercaderia, frecuentemente  viaja hasta la ciudad de Portoviejo donde adquiere a los mayoristas los pedidos para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, también cuenta con la ayuda de una señora que ella le ayuda a vender en otro sector de la región.

Con este nuevo préstamo nuesttra socia invertirá en mercadería sobre todo para la época  playera ha por lo que va a comprar  bermunda y trajes de baño para damas, caballeros y niños, así como otros implementos para la playa.

Su sueño tener su casa propia,  por ahora  vive en un espacio muy reducido  que la mamá le ha dado para que comparta con sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Alianza" meet in the Pachinche neighborhood, 20 minutes from the city of Portoviejo in the Manbí province. There we spoke with Señora Jakeline. She has been through almost 2 loan cycles, and is very pleased with the work that is being done with the Foundation. Jakeline is a single mother of 4 small children who lives in the Cuatro Esquinas neighborhood in the outskirts of Portoviejo. At 28 years of age, she has had to face major challenges, such as caring for and supporting her children, and helping herself economically without neglecting her children. She has a business selling bed sheets, curtains, comforters and awnings. She has been in this line of work for 2 years. She travels through the neighborhood selling door-to-door. She allows her customers to buy her merchandise on credit with easy terms. She often travels to the city of Portoviejo where she acquires from the wholesalers the merchandise ordered by her customers. In addition, she has a woman who works for her and helps her to sell in another area of the region. With this new loan she will invest in merchandise, especially for the beach season. She will buy swim shorts and bathing suits for women, men and children, and other articles for the beach. Her dream is to have her own house, because now she lives in a very small rented space, which her mother has given her to share with her small children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy swim shorts, bathing suits, and other items for the beach season

loans.name: Celia Guillermina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Barrio Sucre se encuentra en la parroquiaCumbe al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la elaboracion de artesanias que son principalmente tejidos, bordado e hilado de lana de oveja, se confeccionan vestimentas, tambien se dedican a la agricultura para sacar adelante no solo su familia sino su población y formar parte del crecimiento económico familiar.

Celia V. es socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, es una socia que cada día lucha para tener un mejor porvenir, se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y  a la cría de cuyes, gallinas  que los vende en su misma comunidad o sale hasta la ciudad de Cuenca para realizar su venta, esta actividad lo realiza hace varios años ya que sus padres le inculcaron esta labor.

Ahora se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo con su banco comunal y  fue gracias a una sobrina que la invito a formar parte de este hermoso grupo de mujeres y nos comenta que los prestamos le han beneficiado mucho en la construcción de su nueva casa.

Celia tiene 63 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja procreando tres hijos que ya son adultos y tiene su propia familia, su esposo es albañil de oficio y gracias a la cooperación marital ahora pueden gozar de su casa propia, por ahora estan contruyendo otra casa que es para sus hijos por lo que el credito solicitado a la Fundación va a invertir en la compra de bloques, arena, cemento, eternir,  para terminar la nueva casa y darles tranquilidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Barrio Sucre” communal bank is in Cumbe parish in the southeast part of the city of Cuenca. Its residents are craftspeople. They are mostly sheep wool clothing weavers and embroiderers. They are also farmers not only for the success of their families but also for their community’s and to be part of their family’s economic growth. Celia V. is a member of the Barrio Sucre communal bank. She is someone who struggles daily to have a better future. She is both a housewife and a small farm animal merchant. She raises guinea pigs and chickens that she sells in her own community or even as far as the city of Cuenca. She has done this for several years since it was her parents who initiated her in this kind of work. She is now in her 4th loan cycle with her communal bank. It was thanks to her niece’s invitation that she became a member of this beautiful group of women. She tells us that the loans have been of great use to her in the construction of her new house. Celia is 63 years old and lives in a common law union with her partner; they have three adult children who have their own families. Her husband is a bricklayer and, thanks to their marital cooperation, they can now enjoy their own home. They are now building another house that will be for their children. This is the purpose of the loan they are requesting from the Institution. She will invest in the purchase of: concrete blocks, sand, cement, Eternit (a brand of fiber/concrete roofing tiles and siding), to finish the new house and provide tranquility for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Norma Evangelina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Barrio Sucre se encuentra en la parroquia de Cumbe al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, sugente se dedica principalmente a la elaboración de artesanías de tejido, bordado e hilado de lana de oveja para la confección de sus prendas de vestir,  también se dedica a la agricultura y muchos de ellos han migrado a las grandes ciudades o al exterior en busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias.

La señora Norma G. vive a las afueras de la Ciudad de Cuenca en la parroquia Cumbe, tiene 49 años de edad esta casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido seis hijos que oscilan entre los 30 20 años de edad  algunos de ellos ya son casados, su casa es propia y aqui habita con dos de sus hijos aún solteros, el de 25 ya trabja y aporta con los gastos de la familia, su esposo se encuentra en el extranjero hace mucho tiempo en busca del sueño americano para brindarles  mejores oportunidades a su familia.

Norma tiene una pequeña tienda en la que  lleva cinco años laborando y ya que cuenta con su clientela fija, también cría  animales y sale los miércoles a vender sus gallinas y  cuyes en la parroquia donde habita, se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo trabajando junto a  la fundación gracias  Rosa Tenecela otra  socia de su banco comunal que la invito a formar parte del mismo, con el nuevo crédito solicitado comprará gallinas, cuyes, chanchos, afrechillo, maíz y algunos productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, para abastecer su tienda.

Su gran sueño es construir un galpón para incrementar su criadero de pollos.
texts.en:
The Barrio Sucre ("Sucre Neighborhood") communal bank is located in the parish of Cumbe, southeast of the city of Cuenca. The people of the area mainly work creating woven and embroidered handicrafts or spinning sheep's wool to make clothing. They also work in agriculture, and many of them have migrated to the larger cities or abroad in search of a better future for their families. Norma G. lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, in Cumbe parish. She is 49 years old and married. Out of this marriage have come six children, who now range from 20 to 30 years old. Some of them are already married. Norma owns her house and lives in it with two of her children who are still single. The 25-year-old already works and helps with the household expenses. Norma's husband has been abroad for a long time, in search of the American dream, in order to provide his family with better opportunities. Norma has a small store where she has worked for five years. Since she has a steady customer base, she is also able to raise animals, and she goes out on Wednesdays to sell her chickens and guinea pigs in the parish where she lives. She is in her fourth loan cycle with the Foundation, thanks to Rosa Tenecela, another member of her communal bank, who invited her to join. With the new loan she is requesting, she will buy chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, feed pellets, corn, and some products to stock her store, such as rice, sugar and cooking oil. Her great dream is to construct a shed so she can expand her chicken farm.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, feed pellets and corn; and rice, sugar, oil and noodles to stock her store

loans.name: Maria Nancy

texts.es:
El banco comunal Barrio Sucre se encuentra en la parroquia de Cumbe al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, sugente se dedica principalmente a la elaboración de artesanías de tejido, bordado e hilado de lana de oveja para la confección de sus prendas de vestir,  también se dedica a la agricultura y muchos de ellos han migrado a las grandes ciudades o al exterior en busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias.

 María Fernández es otra socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, vive a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la parroquia  Cumbe, tiene 40 años de edad, está divorciada hace 3 años y la ruptura de su matrimonio se dio por otra mujer, con su esposo concibió 3 hijos que se encuentran de 17, 16, 5 años de edad, sus hijos mayores trabajan en la construcción cuando alguien les contrata aportando lo poco que ganan para los gastos del hogar y el estudio de su hermana menor,  la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad, ya que es la herencia de su esposo para sus hijos.

María se dedica a la venta de hortalizas en la Feria Libre, esta actividad realiza  desde sus  12 años porque ayudaba a su mamá  en la venta los lunes, sábados y domingos desde 07h00 a 19h00 y ahora ella sigue con esta tracidión, nuestra socia lleva 2 años trabajando con su bankito y nos comenta que le han ayudado mucho para incrementar otros legumbres y frutas en su puesto para ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes,  con  el crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue va a comprar tomate, cebolla,arveja, zanahoria y otras legumbres para abastecer su negocio.

Su gran sueño es salir adelante con sus hijos y entregarle un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
The Barrio Sucre Communal Bank is located in the parish of Cumbe to the southeast of the city of Cuenca, Peru. Those who live there work mainly in the production of traditional textiles, embroidery, and wool yarn that is used to make clothing. Others work in agriculture and many have migrated to larger cities or out of the country searching for a better future for their families. Maria F. is one member of the Barrio Sucre Communal Bank. She lives on the outskirts of Cuenca in the parish of Cumbe. She is 40 years old and has been divorced for three years. Her marriage was broken up by another woman. With her husband she had three children who are now 17, 16 and 5 years old. Her older sons work in construction when there is work to be found. They contribute what little they earn to the household and to their younger sister’s education. The house they live in is theirs, as it was the inheritance left to the children by their father. Maria works selling vegetables at the Feria Libre, a large market in Cuenca. She has been in this line of work since she was 12, as she used to help her mother with sales on Mondays, Saturdays and Sundays from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm. She keeps the same work hours today. Maria has been working with this little bank for two years and she tells us that it has helped her to increase the number of vegetables and fruits at her stand and offer her customers a variety of products. With the loan offered to her by FUNDACION ESPOIR [a Kiva Field Partner] she will buy tomatoes, onions, peas, carrots and other vegetables to stock her business. Her great dream is to get ahead along with her children and to give them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, peas, carrots and some fruits

loans.name: Medelyn

loans.name: Susana Beatriz

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Progresistas se encuentra formado en la ciudad de Cuenca, urbe que  se caracteriza por su belleza arquitectónica como es el Centro Histórico, su belleza natural como es el Parque Nacional Cajas, los cuatro ríos que atraviezan la ciudad, la hospitalidad de su gente y su cultura son atractivos para el turista.

La señora Susana Q. vive en el sector Ricaurte, tiene una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras del banco  comunal, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos se encuentran en el exterior estudiando y trabajando pero solo su hijo  27 le ayuda económicamente, su  su esposo tiene un taller de mecánica en  la casa  de su propiedad.

Susana se dedica a la elaboración  de manualidades, tejidos, pintados, bordados, adornos para el hogar, lleva 19 años en esta labor, vende a su familia y a conocidos, también se encuentra estudiando psicología y se encuentra en el tercer año en la universidad, lleva 10 años trabajando con el bankito y fue incentivada por una compañera de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras, los créditos le han ayudado para seguir creciendo poco a poco con su negocio y el nuevo crédito  a invertir en la compra de materia prima como telas, hilos, encajes, pinturas para elaborar sus artesanias.

Su gran sueño es tener un local propio para la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Mujeres Progresistas” (Progressive Women) was formed in the city of Cuenca, which is characterized by the architectural beauty of its Historical Center. Tourists are attracted to its natural beauty, as seen in Cajas National Park, the four rivers that converge in the city, and the hospitality and culture of its people.

Sra. Susana Q. lives in the neighborhood of Ricaurte. She has become good friends with the other members of the Communal Bank. Susana is married and has four adult children. Two of them live abroad to work and study, but only her 27 year old son helps her financially. Her husband manages an auto repair shop on their property.

Susana produces a variety of handicrafts: woven fabrics, paintings, embroideries, and home decorations. She began working when she was 19 years old, selling crafts to relatives and acquaintances. Susana is also studying psychology and is in her third year at the university. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 10 years and was invited by another member of this group of determined women. The loans she has received have helped her business grow gradually over time. This new loan will be used to purchase materials such as fabric, yarn, lace, and paint for making her handicrafts. Her greatest wish is to open her own store where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, yarn, lace, and paint

loans.name: Maria Justina

texts.es:
La Sra. Justina O. tiene sembrado 3mnz de plátano  en su finca que está ubicada en Tonala-Pto. Morazán.
Ella va a utilizar este crédito para darle mantenimiento a la platanera como en compra de fungicidas, TPH, etc. Además va a comprar alambre y grapas para cercar la platanera para que el ganado no dañe el cultivo.  

Ella piensa que si le hace todos los mantenimientos necesarios a la platanera, podrá sacar buenos ingresos y así mejorar tanto su vida económica como familiar, aunque ella vive solo con su marido ya que todos sus hijos están grandes y son independientes.

Doña María ha tenido 11 créditos con la Institución los cuales los han pagado muy bien en tiempo y forma, y dice estar muy agradecida con CEPRODEL, ya que siempre le ha ayudado cuando ella más lo necesita.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Justina O. has planted 3 mnz of banana in her farm located in Tonala - Puerto Morazan. She will use this loan to maintain the banana plantation and to purchase fungicide, TPH, etc. She will also buy wire and staples to fence the plantation so that the cattle doesn't damage the harvest. She believes that if she performs all of the necessary maintenance for the banana plantation, she will earn enough income and in this way improve both her family life and her finances, although she lives only with her husband since all of her sons are grown-up and independent. Doña Maria has already had 11 loans with the institution, and they have always been paid on time, and she says she is very grateful with CEPRODEL, since she has always received help when she has most needed it.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintenance of banana plantation

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Cesar Manfredo

texts.es:
El Sr. Manfredo A. tiene servicio agrícola de Transporte con la Alcaldía El Viejo y el Ingenio Monte Rosa.
El va a utilizar este crédito para comprar repuestos para darle mantenimiento a un tractor ya que le está presentando fallas. 
El comenzó su negocio cuando trabajaba como mecánico automotriz en un taller, fue entonces cuando decidió comprar su primer tractor.

De  las ganancias que le genero el primer tractor ha comprado dos más y hoy en día  tiene 3 tractores.

El Sr. A. dice estar demás muy agradecido por la ayuda que le ha brindado CEPRODEL al  darle créditos para el poder hacer todos los mantenimientos a sus tractores, y así poder generar  mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Manfredo A. has an agricultural transport service with El Viejo's City Hall and with Ingenio Monte Rosa. He will use the funds to buy replacement parts to service a tractor that is beginning to break down. He began his business when he worked at an auto repair shop; that was when he decided to buy his first tractor. With profits generated by his first tractor he bought two more; now he owns three tractors. Mr. A. states that he is more than grateful to CEPRODEL for granting his loans so that he has been able to service and repair his tractors thus earning higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tractor replacement parts.

loans.name: Maria De Cristo

texts.es:
La Sra. María P. vende huevos y ropa usada en su casa que está ubicada en el municipio del viejo.  
Ella va a usar el crédito para comprar varias cajillas de huevo y ropa usada y nueva para vender. 
Ella comenzó su negocio cuando la jubilaron de la escuela donde trabajaba, fue ahí entonces cuando puso su pequeño negocio en su casa. 
Ella vive sola ya que su marido falleció hace ya varios años e hijos nunca tuvo. 
Ella dice estar muy agradecida con CEPRODEL, por todo el tiempo que la ha ayudado a salir adelante y seguir luchando con su negocio.
texts.en:
María P. sells eggs and used clothing from her home, which is located in El Viejo. She will use the funds to buy several cases of eggs and new and used clothing to sell. She began this work when she was retired from the school she worked at; that was when she set up a small store in her home. She lives alone because her husband died several years ago and she never had any children. She says that she is very grateful to CEPRODEL because it has always helped her to get ahead and to continue struggling with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs and clothing to sell.

loans.name: 015 Quang Hung Group

texts.en:
H. V. T. is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  H. is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 015 Quang Hung.


H. is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling cabinets and wardrobe furniture to local businesses and community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for more than eight years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, H. joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  The loan will be her fourth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other group members:

1.  Nguyen T. Dam is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

2.  L. T. Binh is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a restaurant.

3.  H. T. Hue is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. V. T. (44) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 015 Quang Hung (015 Quang Hung).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán tủ kéo & tủ áo quần cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2007, H. đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới T.ệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyen T. Dam (43) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  L. T. Binh (45) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh nhà hàng.


3.  H. T. Hue (42) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Zarlasht Abedi Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Mustafa has a painting business and he is a good painter. He is a 24-year-old man who lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He has two small kids. He paints houses, shops and offices. He has been working in this business for more than three years with lots of experience in painting. Now he wants to buy more paints and other necessary supplies for his shop. 

Mustafa is a member of Zarlasht Abedi Group. With a loan for more stock for his shop, he will be able to support his whole family. He wants to thank all lenders from Kiva and AFS in Afghanistan. It’s a big help for small businesses.

loans.use: To puchase more materials

loans.name: Hakima

texts.en:
This is Hakima, daughter of K. M.. She is 23 years old, married and lives with her whole family of six members. She is one of the staff of the Interior Ministry of Afghanistan. She has been working for more than two years. Now she wants to host a wedding party for her youngest brother, but she can’t.

When Hakima was informed that the loan process is supporting the people, she came to AFS. She wants to receive an individual loan of 50,000 afghanis for her brother's wedding party. She would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders that support people around the world through this effective process.

loans.use: Expenses of brother's wedding

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena has one hectare of farmland that she wishes to harvest.  Last harvest, she managed to produce 80 sacks of rice.  She is aiming to produce the same, if not more this time around.  She also will use the loan to buy feed for her two female pigs who are both producing piglets.  She sells the piglets at the local market.  Elena really wants her two businesses to do well so that her two children can enjoy a good education.  Elena started borrowing in 2008 and is really grateful for the progress she has been able to see so far.

loans.use: Rice harvesting and pig feed

loans.name: Bernado

texts.en: Bernado is asking for a loan in order to convert a half hectare of currently undeveloped land into a rice field. As Bernado is a single man with no children, he is able to devote himself to his business interests and has a real passion for rice farming. He received his first loan in 2008 and is extremely grateful for not only the loan, but also the extra services made available to him.  These include savings, interest and hospital benefits.

loans.use: Turn land into rice field

loans.name: Karamatkhan's Group

texts.ru:
Кыргызстан – горная страна. И большинство её территории занимают красивые горные цепи, на склонах и подножьях которых расположены самые чудесные пастбища. И поэтому кыргызы испокон веков занимаются скотоводством, и даже сейчас в двадцать первом  веке скотоводство, торговля скотом, является неотъемлемой частью экономики страны. Ведь большая часть населения живёт в сельской местности и в основном занимается сельским хозяйством и скотоводством. Так и герои нашей истории имеют прямое отношение к этому самому древнему ремеслу кыргызского народа. Таштанбекова Караматхан – лидер данной группы. Она вместе с семьёй живёт в г. Карабалта. Караматхан тридцать один год. У неё двое детей. Так как дети пока ещё дошкольного возраста, Караматхан пока не работает и находится дома и обеспечением семьи занимается муж. В течение многих лет муж Караматхан и сама Караматхан бережно копили средства и на эти сбережения купили скот для перепродажи. И уже на протяжении четырёх лет, перепродажа скота является основным источником пропитания для семьи Караматхан. Доход от перепродажи составляет около восьми тысяч сомов ($180), в месяц. И учитывая тот факт, что они в начале, вложили в бизнес восемнадцать тысяч сомов ($450), то их нынешний доход является довольно внушительным. За последнее время им даже удалось купить мебель и бытовую технику.  Сейчас Караматхан нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить скот для перепродажи. В ближайшем будущем они планируют купить автомобиль и построить дом. 

У Караматхан три партнёра по группе:

Тургунбаевой Тажинисе тридцать два года. У Тажинисы двое сыновей. Старший сын уже начал ходить в школу. Муж Тажинисы торгует на рынке ящиками для овощей, а сама Тажиниса по возможности помогает мужу и параллельно занимается воспитанием детей. Тажинися обратилась за кредитом, чтобы закупить овощи для перепродажи.

Турганбаевой Ырысбу сорок три года. Ырысбу мать восьмерых детей. Старшие дочери замужем. Один сын работает в Бишкеке, а младшие дети учатся в школе. Ырысбу вместе с мужем занимаются животноводством и продажей молока. Они обратились за кредитом, так как им сейчас нужны средства, чтобы купить овец для разведения.

Разакуловой Жылдыз сорок два года. Муж Жылдыз работает в России. У Жылдыз четверо детей. Старшие сыновья работают в швейном цехе, а младшие учатся в школе. Жылдыз имеет скот и продаёт молоко. И теперь она надеется получить кредит и купить корову для перепродажи.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Kyrgyzstan is a mountainous country, with most of its territory spanned by beautiful mountain chains. Along the slopes and at the base of the mountains are some of the most glorious pastures. That’s why Kyrgyzstan has long been known for its cattle ranching. Even now, in the twenty-first century, the cattle business is an essential part of the country’s economy, with most of the population living in rural areas and working primarily in farming and cattle-raising. The subject of our story is also directly involved with this time-honored profession of the Kyrgyzstan people. Karamatkhan T. is the head of her group. She and her family live in the city of Kara-Balta. She is thirty-one and has two pre-school-aged children, so for the time being she is not working and stays at home while her husband provides for the family. For many years, Karamatkhan and her husband saved up their money and bought cattle for resale. Over the past four years, cattle resale has become her family’s primary livelihood. The return on the resale comes to around eight-thousand som ($180) per month. And considering the fact that they are just starting out and have invested eighteen-thousand som ($450) in their business, their current income is quite impressive. Karamatkhan currently needs a loan so she can purchase cattle for resale. In the near future, they plan to buy a car and build a house. She has three partners in her group: Tadjinisa T. is thirty-three and has two sons. Her eldest is already in school. Her husband sells vegetable containers at the market. Tadjinisa helps her husband as much as she can while still raising the children. She requested the loan to buy vegetables for resale. Iyris T. is forty-three and the mother of eight children. Her eldest daughter is married. One of her sons works in Bishkek and the younger children are in school. Iyris and her husband breed livestock and sell milk. They requested the loan because they’re in need of capital to buy sheep for breeding. Jyldyz R. is forty-four and her husband works in Russia. She has four children; the eldest works in a sewing shop and the younger ones are in school. She raises cattle and sells milk. She hopes to receive a loan to buy beef for resale. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.ru:
В нынешнее время всё чаще можно встретить человека, который вследствие жизненных проблем жалуется и критикует всё и вся. Человеку свойственно искать виноватого в какой-либо ситуации, и в основном он находит его в лице других людей: начальника, государства, самой жизни, или ещё в чём – либо, но только не в себе.  Тем не менее, есть и такие люди, которые вместо того, чтобы кого – либо винить всего на всего прилагают усилия в силу собственных сил и возможностей и пытаются изменить свою жизнь к лучшему. В данной группе, люди принадлежат среднему слою населения. И никто из них не отличается чем – то особенным в материальном плане. Байсабаева Дамира – лидер данной группы. Ей тридцать два года. Она замужем и живёт со своей семьёй в г. Карабалта. Для того, чтобы помогать мужу обеспечивать семью, Дамира три года назад занялась розничной торговлей товарами повседневного спроса (различные продукты питания, спички, соль, сахар и т.п.). Дамира, прежде чем заняться торговлей, посоветовалась с сестрой, и они вместе вложили свои сбережения в этот бизнес. По прошествии трёх лет, Дамира имеет ежемесячный доход в размере восьми тысяч сомов ($180). Более того, её бизнес помог ей приобрести автомобиль. В данное время Дамире требуется кредит. Дамире он нужен, чтобы закупить новую партию товаров к предстоящему сезону весенних праздников. В будущем, она надеется купить павильон. 

Вместе с Дамирой в группе ещё три человека:

Фегеле Альфие, тридцать один год. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Старший сын ходит в школу, а младший пока дома. Муж Альфии – сварщик. Он предоставляет услуги сварщика, изготавливает железные ворота, решётки и печи. Когда – то муж Альфии сам устроился к сварщику в помощнику, но в дальнейшем решил работать самостоятельно. Сейчас её мужу требуется кредит. Ему необходимы средства, для того, чтобы купить материалы для работы.

Бекбосун – кызы Жылдыз двадцать семь лет. Муж Жылдыз работает в частной пилораме. Жылдыз имеет двух детей. Дети маленькие и поэтому по большей части обеспечением семьи занимается муж Жылдыз. Параллельно он также занимается перепродажей овец. Сейчас Жылдыз надеется получить кредит, чтобы купить овец.

Сарыбаеву Бекжану двадцать три года. Бекжан холост и занимается перевозкой пассажиров. Три года назад он вместе с братом купили машину и начали таксовать. Бекжан также обеспечивает сестру, которой четырнадцать лет. Бекжану нужен кредит, чтобы купить бычка на содержание.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Nowadays it is more and more common to see people who react to their problems by constantly complaining and blaming others. It is human nature to seek fault with someone else, and usually people find someone or something to blame: their boss, the government, life in general, anything but themselves. Nevertheless, there are people who, instead of assigning blame, do their best in order to change their lives for the better. All members of the group being presented is middle-class. No one has any special financial advantage. The leader of the group is Damira B.. She is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her family in the town of Karabalta. In order to help her husband meet the family expenses, three years ago she started a business retailing various everyday goods (foodstuffs, matches, salt, sugar etc). Before launching this business, she discussed it with her sister, and they invested their savings jointly. Now, three years later, Damira has a monthly income of 8,000 somos ($180). Moreover, her business made it possible for her to buy a car. Now Damira needs a loan. She needs it in order to buy a new stock of goods for the upcoming season of spring holidays. In the future, she hopes to buy a retail kiosk. In addition to Damira, there are three more individuals in this group: Alfiya F. is 31 years old. She is married and has two children. The older son goes to school; the younger one is still in pre-school age and stays at home. Alfiya’s husband is a welder. He provides welding services, making iron gates, grills and ovens. Sometime ago he was working as a welder’s assistant, but later he decided to work independently. Now Alfiya’s husband is in need of a loan. He needs to purchase work supplies. Jyldyz B.-K. is 27 years old. Jyldyz’ husband works in a private company. Jyldyaz has two children. The children are still young, and so it mostly falls to the husband to provide for the family. He also resells sheep on the side. Jyldyz is hoping to obtain a loan in order to buy sheep for resale. Bekjan S. is 23 years old. He is single, and his business is passenger transport. Three years ago he and his brother bought a car and started a taxi business. Bekjan also supports his 14-year old sister. He needs funds in order to buy a bull calf to raise.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase the stock of foodstuff prior to the spring holiday season

loans.name: Duyunbubu's Group

texts.ru:
В серой действительности повседневной жизни, даже проходя по улице среди огромного количества людей, нам трудно даже представить себе, как живут другие люди. Иногда человек очень прилично одет, но оказывается, что он не очень – то богат. А иногда наоборот: идёт человек, в довольно поношенной старой одежде, а оказывается это его рабочая одежда, а он сам – владелец какого – нибудь заведения. Как бы там ни было, герои нашей истории обыкновенные люди, из тех самых, что окружают нас каждый день на улице. Но людей этой категории, от серой массы отличает один аспект. Этот аспект заключается в том, что у них есть сильное желание и стремление изменить собственную жизнь к лучшему. И их желание выражается конкретными замыслами и чувством ответственности. Например, Джакыпова Дуйунбубу. Она – лидер этой группы. Она живёт в г. Токмоке вместе с дочкой, которая в данный момент работает продавцом сувениров в Объединённых Арабских Эмиратах. Дуйунбубу разведена и чтобы обеспечивать себя и дочку в свои пятьдесят шесть лет, Дуйунбубу шьёт национальные изделия, также так называемые на кыргызском языке - «тошоки» (patchwork quilts). Когда Дуйунбубу осталась без работы, она быстро сообразила, что пришло время самой находить себе работу, и она начала шить тошоки на продажу. Сейчас это занятие приносит ей немногим не малым около четырёх тысяч сом ($100) в месяц. Дуйнунбубу обратилась за кредитом с целью закупить материал для пошива в преддверии праздников. 

У Дуйунбубу три партнёра по группе:

Сариевой Зине пятьдесят лет. Она вдова, но у неё четверо детей. Дети уже взрослые и сами себя обеспечивают. Однако Зина никоим образом не зависит от своих детей и сама занимается бизнесом. Она продаёт халаты. Продажа халатов приносит Зине около десяти тысяч сом в месяц. Зине нужен кредит, чтобы купить контейнер.

Жумалиевой Жылдызкан сорок четыре года. Её супруг работает строителем. Жылдызкан торгует национальными изделиями: тошоками, подушками и коврами. У Жылдызкан также один сын, который работает слесарем в СТО. 
Жылдызкан сейчас нуждается в кредите. Она хочет купить разные цвета материалов, чтобы изготавливать ковры.

Атакановой Нургул тридцать лет. Вместе с мужем Нургул воспитывает одну дочь, которой пять лет. Муж Нургул работает в ОсОО Умут и Ка, а сама Нургул занимается торговлей шарфов. Нургул решила обратиться за кредитом, так как ей нужны средства, чтобы закупить товар.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
In the gray reality of everyday life, even passing among a large number of people on the street, it is difficult for us to imagine how other people live. Sometimes a person is very well dressed, but turns out that he is not rich. And sometimes it is the opposite: a person walks by wearing fairly old, worn clothing, but turns out that this is his work uniform, and he is an owner of some type of company. However it may be, the heroes of our story are ordinary people, those who surround us every day on the street. But people in this category differ from the gray masses in one aspect, which is the strong will and drive to change their lives for the better. And their will is expressed in concrete ideas and responsibility. Take, for example, Duyunbubu D.. She lives in the city of Tokmak together with her daughter, who currently sells souvenirs in the United Arab Emirates. Duyunbubu is divorced, and at fifty-six years old, in order to support herself and her daughter, she sews traditional goods, also called “toshoki” (patchwork quilts) in the Kyrgyz language. When Duyunbubu lost her job, she quickly realized that the time has come to find work for herself and started sewing toshoki for sale. Now this business yields her around four thousand som ($100) per month. Duyunbubu requested this loan in order to purchase fabric for sewing in anticipation of the holidays. Duyunbubu has three partners in this group: Zina S. is fifty years old. She is a widow and has four children. The children are already grown and provide for themselves. However, Zina is in no way dependent on her children and has her own business. She sells robes. The sale of robes yields Zina around ten thousand som per month. Zina needs a loan in order to purchase a container. Jyldyzkan J. is forty-four years old. Her husband is a construction worker. Jyldyzkan sells traditional goods, such as toshoki, pillows and rugs. She also has one son, who works as a mechanic at the technical service station. Jyldyzkan currently needs a loan. She wants to purchase materials of various colors in order to make rugs. Nurgul A. is thirty years old. Together with her husband, Nurgul is raising one daughter, who is five years old. Nurgul’s husband works at the Umrut and Ka milk processing factory, and Nurgul is involved in selling scarves. Nurgul decided to request a loan because she needs the means in order to purchase merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric for sewing in anticipation of the holidays.

loans.name: Zinaida's Group

texts.ru:
Люди, которые никогда не отчаиваются и всегда извлекают самое позитивное из всего того, что их окружает в жизни, заслуживают всеобщего уважения. Это люди, которые не жалуются на превратности судьбы и просто стараются использовать все свои возможности, для того, чтобы осуществить поставленные цели. В нынешнее время, когда кругом безработица, герои нашей истории, как раз из той самой категории людей. Касымова Зинаида – лидер группы. Зинаида вместе с мужем и двумя сыновьями проживают в г. Токмок. Это маленький город, который ещё в союзные годы славился промышленным потенциалом. Но с развалом союза, практически все промышленные объекты государственного значения перестали функционировать и многие покинули город, а те, кто остались, пошли торговать на базар. Зинаида принадлежит к тем, кто остался. Несмотря на трудное положение в городе, два года назад по совету знакомой, она начала торговать свитерами и джинсовыми брюками. Её муж занимается евроремонтом. Старшему сыну десять, а младшему всего год. Торговля Зинаида позволяет вести более или менее достойную жизнь. Она купила телевизор для дома и детскую кровать. Для того, чтобы начать торговлю, понадобилось вложить большие средства: двадцать тысяч сомов ($500). Но Зинаида, знала, что её цель оправдает её ожидания и пошла до конца. В данный момент, Зинаиде требуется кредит. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент товара к сезону и по этой причине обратилась за кредитом. 

У Зинаиды три партнёра по группе:

Алишеровой Зарине двадцать восемь лет. Муж Зарины работает в отделе охраны. Зарина же продаёт разные виды женских кофточек и мужские свитера. Зарина занимается торговлей уже три года и при этом у неё ещё и два маленьких ребёнка. Зарина нуждается в получении кредита, чтобы закупить новые виды товара.

Жумалиевой Серенгуль тридцать четыре года. Серенгуль помогает мужу заниматься животноводством, и помимо этого также изготавливает национальный напиток «бозо» и сдает его по магазинам. По выходным, они выходят на скотный рынок, чтобы перепродавать скот. Серенгуль обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить бычка для откорма и перепродажи.

Чекировой Дамире сорок шесть лет. Дамира имеет одну дочь. Дочь ходит в школу. Дамира вместе с мужем планируют заняться животноводством. До сих пор Дамира работала в доме ребёнка медсестрой. Из – за маленькой зарплаты Дамира начала думать о бизнесе. И она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить бычка.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
People, who never despair and always find the positive out of everything around them in life, deserve everyone’s respect. These are the people, who do not complain about vicissitudes and simply try to use all of the possible opportunities in order to achieve their goals. In the current times, when there is unemployment everywhere, the heroes of our story are precisely characterized as people in this resilient category. Zinaida K. is the leader of this group. Zinaida, her husband and their two sons live in the town of Tokmak. It is a small town that was famous for its industrial potential during the Soviet years. But with the breakup of the Union, all of the government industrial sites stopped functioning, and many people left the town, and those who stayed became involved in sales at the market. Zinaida is one of those who stayed. Despite the difficult conditions in the town, she took the advice of her friend and started selling sweaters and jeans two years ago. Her husband is involved in European-style remodeling. The oldest son is ten years old, and the youngest is only one. The retail business allows Zinaida to lead a more or less decent life. She bought a television for the house along with a child’s bed. She had to invest a significant amount of money – twenty thousand som ($500) – in order to start the retail business. But Zinaida knew that her expectations will be met and went through with it. Currently, Zinaida needs a loan. She wants to increase the merchandise variety for the season and requested a loan for this purpose. Zinaida has three partners in this group: Zarina A. is twenty-eight years old. Her husband works at a security department. Zaria sells various types of women’s blouses and men’s sweaters. She has been involved in retail sales for three years. She also has two small children. Zarina needs a loan in order to purchase new types of merchandise. Serengul J. is thirty-four years old. She helps her husband in the animal husbandry business and also makes a traditional drink, called “bozo”, and sells it to stores. On the weekends, Zarina and her husband go to the livestock market in order to resell livestock. Serengul requested the loan to purchase a bull for feeding and resale. Damira C. is forty-six years old. She has one daughter, who attends school. Damira and her husband plan to get involved in animal husbandry. Up to now, Damira worked as a pediatric nurse. She began thinking about her own business due to the low salary at that job. So she decided to request a loan in order to buy a bull.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase seasonal merchandise variety

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a calf for fattening and reselling later

loans.name: Ludya

texts.en:
Ludya was born in 1958 and she is married to Mr. John Boswony. They have seven children: Julia, 28; Pamela, 25; Sammy, 24, (University Student); Dorine, 20, (secondary student); Carolyne, 18, (secondary student ); Ronald, 16; and Hazael, 12, (in primary school).

Ludya is a farmer; she plants vegetables, maize and Irish potatoes. She started this farming business in 1989, and she earns a monthly profit of Kshs 10,000. She also gets Kshs. 2,000 per month from other sources of income. Her clients are mostly residents of Timboiywo centre.

Ludya has not borrowed from another source before Kadet. A friend introduced her to Kadet Ltd. She has borrowed an agriculture loan worth Kshs. 60,000 from Kadet Ltd. and she intends to buy farm inputs to help her grow maize. This includes maize seeds and fertilizers. If this loan boosts her business, Ludya plans to use the extra profit to pay school fees. 

She dreams of purchasing more land, and she describes herself as polite and hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Noemi Piedad

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Progresistas se encuentra formado en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por la belleza arquitectónica de su Centro Histórico, la belleza natural de sus montañas y parajes andinos como es el Parque Nacional Cajas, los cuatro ríos, la gente y su cultura. son atractivos turisticos para nacionales y extranjeros.

Noemí O. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Progresistas, ella vive en el centro de la Ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 54 años esta casada siendo el fruto de su unión conyugal el haber concebido 5 hijos que se encuentran de 33, 22, 19, 18, 16 años,  sólo su hijo de 22 años se encuentra casado y vive de forma independiente,  su esposo es músico de profesión y canta en un trío cuando tiene contratos, la casa en la que habitan no es de su propiedad por lo que vive arrendando aún.

Ella  es costurera hace diez años y confecciona principalmente ropa de mujer para toda ocasión  cuenta con una clientela muy fiel y selecta, este año reingreso al bankito ya que por motivos de fuerza mayor tuvo que dejar su grupo de trabajo, con el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregará va a pagar el trámite de legalización de las escrituras de un terreno para buscar hacer realidad su sueño de construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Progresistas is found in the city of Cuenca. This city is characterised by the architectural beauty of its historical centre, the natural beauty of its mountains and Andean sites such as the Cajas National Park, the 4 rivers, its people and culture. They are attractive to tourists both nationally and internationally. Noemí O. is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Progresistas. She lives in the centre of Cuenca city. She is 54, married and the fruit of her conjugal union are the 5 children she has conceived: 33, 22, 19, 18 and 16 years of age. Only one son, 22, is married and lives independently. Her husband is a professional musician and sings in a trio when they have contracts. The house where they live is not their property as they are still renting. Noemí has been a seamstress for 10 years and mainly makes women's clothing for every occasion. She has a very loyal and select clientele. This year she has reentered the bank - due to stronger motives she had to leave her working group. WIth the new loan that FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR will grant her she will pay the bill for legalising the paperwork on a parcel of land, to seek to turn into reality her dream of building her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Legal costs for purchase of land

loans.name: Maria Gertrudiz

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Progresistas se encuentra formado en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por la belleza arquitectónica de su Centro Histórico, la belleza natural del  Parque Nacional Cajas, los cuatro ríos que bañan la urbe cuencana, su gente y su cultura son su carta de presentaión y se ha convertido en uno de los lugares mas visitados por turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

La señora  María Pérez es socia  activa del banco comunal Mujeres Progresistas  que son un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras dispuestas a salir adelante con su familia a  base de trabajo en equipo y sobre todo cultivando  el sentimiento de amistad que hay entre todas.

María trabaja como consultora de belelza de los productos YANBAL, lleva ya 15 años trabajando en esta actividad y nos comenta que por el momento las ventas están bajas y casi ya no tiene ganancia, pero gracias a su clientela fiel espera que todo mejore, además nos manifiesta que es una de las socias fundadoras del banco comunal pues ya  lleva 12 años y fue la señora María Ortega quien la incentivó para formar parte de este hermoso grupo y acceder a los créditos que otorga la Fundación, desde entonces los prestamos solicitados ha invertido en su negocio para incrementar poco a poco mercaderia para su exigente clientela.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 69 años y vive a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca con su esposo taxista de profesión, su último hijo de tres que tubo, los dos primeros ya son cadados y viven independientes y una nieta de 18 años ya que sus padres se encuentran en el exterior  y envian dinero para su educación y manutención,  la casa en la que habitan es el fruto del esfuerzo conyugal de su juventud.

Con el nuevo crédito solicitado comprará labiales, perfumes,cremas, tratamientos, bisuteria, etc.  Yanbal para abstecer los pedidos de sus clientes. Su gran sueño es contar con buena salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Progresistas communal bank was founded in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for it’s architectural beauty in the Historical Center, the natural beauty of Cajas National Park, the four rivers that bath the capital city Cuenca, it’s people and it’s culture which are it’s best introduction. It has become one of the places most visited by national and foreign tourists. Mrs. María Pérez is an active member of the Mujeres Progresistas communal bank. It’s a group of enterprising women prepared to get ahead for their families through team work and cultivating above all the friendly feeling there is among all. María works as a beauty consultant for YANBAL products. She has already been working in this for 15 years. She mentioned to us that the sales are low at the moment and she has almost no profit. But thanks to her faithful clientele she hopes everything improves. She also told us that she is one of the founding members of the communal bank. She has been in it for 12 years. It was Mrs. María Ortega who encouraged her to become part of this beautiful group and gain access to the loans granted by the Foundation. Since then she has invested the loans she applied for in her business to increase stock little by little for her demanding clientele. She is 69 years old and lives outside the city of Cuenca with her husband who is a taxi driver, the last of three children she has and an 18-year-old granddaughter since her parents are living abroad. They send money for her education and board. The house they live in is the fruit of their efforts in their youth as a married couple. With the new loan she applied for she will buy lip sticks, perfumed creams, treatments, costume jewelry, etc. and Yanbal to fill her customers’ orders. Her big dream is to count on good health in order to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Lip sticks, creams, treatments, perfumes, costume jewelry and more cosmetics from the Yanbal line.

loans.name: Rosa Amleia

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Paraíso se encuentra en la parroquia Cumbe al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca  es conocida por su gran producción ganadera y lechera, también su gente adulta se dedica a la agricultura pues en gran parte los jóvenes han migrado a las grandes ciudades del Ecuador o fuera del país en busca de mejores días para toda la familia por lo que ahora podemos apreciar muchas extensiones de tierra abandonados puesto que ya no hay quien las trabaje, es por eso que ahora encontramos a las mujeres agrupadas en grupos de trabajo para salir adelante en su propia  tierra.

Rosa G. es socia de éste banco  es una mujer  que siempre nos llena con su alegría en todo momento, esta cursando su segundo ciclo en el banco comunal, ella  posee una pequeña tienda de abarrotes desde hace 8 años  laborando todos los dias  de 6 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. y nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos pero siempre agradece a Dios por el trabajo diario, también se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos la cual la realiza en su misma casa.

Ella vive en la parroquia Cumbe en el sector 24 de Mayo Alto, tiene 33 años de edad, esta casada  pero solo vive con sus dos hijos de 14 y 11 años pues su esposo hace tres años migro del país para brindarles una mejor educación y estabilidad económica, gracias al trabajo y apoyo de pareja ahora cuentan con su casa propia, con el crédito solicitado abastecerá su tienda de abarrotes  comprando arroz, azúcar, aceite, articulos de cuidado personal, etc.,

Su mayor sueño es que su  esposo regrese para estar toda la familia junta.
texts.en:
The El Paraíso communal bank is found in Cumbe parish to the southeast of the city of Cuenca. It’s know for it’s large cattle and milk production. The adults also work in agriculture. The young people have mostly migrated to the big cities of Ecuador or out of the country looking for better days for the whole family. That is why we can observe many extensions of land abandoned since there isn’t anyone to work it. This is why we now find the women grouped in work groups to get ahead on their own land. Rosa G. is a member of this bank. She is a woman who always fills us with her joy at each moment. She is in her second cycle with the communal bank. She has had a small grocery store for the past 8 years. She has worked every day from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. She tells us there are good days and bad days but she always thanks God for the daily work. She also raises and sells chickens which she does from her own home. She lives in Cumbre parish, section 24 of Mayo Alto. She is 33 years old. She is married but lives alone with her two children who are 14 and 11 years old. Her husband migrated from the country three years ago to offer them a better education and economic stability. Thanks to work and the support of her husband, she now has her own house. She will stock her grocery store buying rice, sugar, oil, personal care products, etc. with the loan she applied for. Her biggest dream is that her husband returns so the family is all together.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, salt, oil, pasta and personal care products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Carmita De Lourdes

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Paraíso se encuentra en la parroquia Cumbe, al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, es conocida por su producción ganadera y lechera, también su gente adulta  se dedica a la agricultura, ya que en gran parte los jovenes han migrado a las grandes ciudades del país o fuera de él por lo que ahora podemos apreciar mucha tierra abandonada obligando a las mujeres a agruparese para salir adelante en su propia tierra como las socias de éste banco.

Carmita es una socia joven de este banco, con 21 años apenas ya es nadre de una niña de un año,  vive en unión libre con su pareja que trabaja como albañil como no tienen casa propia viven en la de un familiar que les presto.

Nuestra socia se  dedica a la cría de pollos, los que vende pelados  en las tiendas de su comunidad, a sus vecinas y conocidas, antes vendía ropa pero no le fue muy bien y perdió toda la mercaderia y su capital.  Lleva tres años  trabajando con la Fundación  y gracias al primer credito recibido  pudo montar su negocio de pollos, con el dinero del nuevo prestamo requerido va a comprar bloques,cemento,, hojas de zinc para construir un galpón más grande para incrementar su criadero de pollos. 

Su meta es llegar a tener varios criaderos de pollos y engrandecer su negocio.
texts.en:
The El Paraíso Communal Bank is located in the parish of Cumbe, to the southeast of the city of Cuenca. The area is known for its cattle and milk production. Many of the older working-age adults in this community work in agriculture, while the majority of the young people have migrated to larger cities or out of the country. For this reason one can find lots of abandoned land, and the women of the community found it necessary to band together as members of this bank in order to successfully work their own lands. Carmita is a younger member of the bank. Just 21 years old, she has a one-year-old daughter and lives in a common-law union with her partner, who is a bricklayer. Since they don't have their own home, they live in a relative's house that was lent to them. This bank member works raising chickens, which she then skins and sells in stores in her community, and to her neighbors and acquaintances. She used to sell clothing but it didn't go well and she lost both her investment and her merchandise. She's been working with the ESPOIR Foundation for three years and thanks to the first loan she received she was able to start her chicken business. With the money from the current loan she is going to buy blocks, cement and zinc plates to build a larger storehouse and expand her chicken breeding area. Carmita's goal is to eventually have various chicken coops and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blocks, cement and zinc plates to build a larger storehouse.

loans.name: Blanca Guillermina

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Paraíso se encuentra en la parroquia Cumbe al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, es conocida por su producción ganadera y lechera, también su gente adulta se dedica a la agricultura ya que gran parte de los jovenes han migrado a las grandes ciudades del país y al extranjero para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, en esta region encontramos muchas mujeres solas que se han agrupado para salir a adelante con sus hijos en su terruño.  

La señora Blanca P. es socia del banco comunal El Paraíso es una socia muy carismática y amable, vive en el sector la Floresta, tiene 52 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión ha procreado 4 hijos que se encuentran de 26, 24, 20 y 18 años todos ya casados, su ultimo hijo vive en suca y comparte con ella los gastos del hogar,  su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Machala en una bananera, siendo la recompensa de muchos años de sacrificio el tener su casa propia.

Blanca es empleada en una casa labora  en ella ya 18 años de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de gallinas, cuyes y chanchos, que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica y tambien es para el consumo en su hogar. Se encuentra trabajando con  los créditos de la fundación hace un año y éstos le han permitido solventar algunos apuros en su hogar, con el nuevo crédito va a comprar  dos  terneras ya que tiene hierba en unos potreros que recibió de herencia de sus padres, su sueño es poder construir otra casa para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The community bank "El Paraíso" can be found in the parish of Cumbe to the southeast of the city of Cuenca. It is know for its meat and dairy farming, and the adults of Cumbe work as farmers as a large number of the young people have migrated to the big cities of the country and abroad in order to offer their families a better quality of life. In this region we find many many women who are without their husbands and who have banded together in order to get by successfully with their children in their homeland.

Blanca is a member of the community bank El Paraíso, and is a very charismatic and kind woman. She lives in the "La Floresta" neighborhood, is 52 years old, is married, and has 4 children who are 26, 24, 20, and 18 years old. They are all married, and her youngest child lives in her house and shares the household expenses with her. Her husband works in the city of Machala in a banana plantation. As the reward of many years of sacrifice, they now own their home.

Blanca is a domestic employee and has worked in the same home for 18 years, working from Monday to Friday, 8:00am to 5:00pm. She also works breeding chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs, which she sells when they have any financial needs and which they also eat at home. She has been working with loans from the Foundation for one year and these have enabled her to solve some difficulties in her home. With the new loan she is going to buy two calves as she has grass in some pastures that she was left by her parents. Her dream is to build a house in order to help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two calves

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Florencia

texts.es:
La señaora  María P. es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive en la parroquia el Valle en la  comunidad San Pedro, esta localidad se caracteriza por tener una gran producción de maíz, papas etc., su gente se dedica a varias actividades como  albañil, carpinteros, acerradores, especialmente los mas jóvenes y algunos de ellos han migrado a otros países para brindar a su familia una mejor solvencia económica.

María  se encuentra realizando los créditos con su  bankito hace 2 ciclos para incrementar su producción de pollos ya que se dedica a la cría y venta de estos y los comercializa en pie o pelados en las tiendas o a sus vecinas de su comunidad, también tiene una vaca y 2 becerros. 

Ella es una mujer luchadora y alegre tiene 63 años de edad, siendo su estado civil casada y madre de 7 hijos de los cuales 6 de ellos son casados y uno vive en su casa de manera independiente, solo su hija de 26 años es soltera, trabaja confeccionando pantalones y si aporta para la economía de su hogar, su esposo no trabaja porque se encuentra enfermo, la casa en la que habitan se encuentra viejita ya que tiene varios años pero se siente tranquila porque es de su propiedad.

Con el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  comprará   más pollos, alimento y vitaminas para su crianza,  su gran sueño es salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the community bank "Siempre Amigas" and lives in the parish of Valle in the community of San Pedro. This locality is characterized by its high production of corn, potatoes, etc. The people there work at various activities such as being masons, carpenters, and steelworking, especially the youngest, and some of them have emigrated to other countries in order to offer their families better economic conditions.
