She buys drinks from the company’s sales representative who goes around town supplying buyers at their business place. She has been in this business since 1990 and has recorded success. With part of her profit, she helps her husband who is a commercial driver to pay their bills and she reinvests the rest into her business. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.


Elizabeth is 56 years old, married with four children and they are doing well. She further said they intend to renovate the building where they live in Lagos State, Nigeria. She says a big thank you to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Pictured here is Mariatu M., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Mariatu is seeking a loan of SLL 2,500,000 for the first time from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to expand her business, make more sales and consequently improve her living conditions. 

Mariatu is approximately 35 years of age. She was born in Makeni; she is single with 4 children. Two of her children are in secondary school, one in primary school and one in nursery school. For over a year now, Mariatu has been a businesswoman, she sells batteries, rice, vegetable oil, cocoa, candles, cigarettes, soap and many more items. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above items wholesale.

loans.use: Buys batteries, rice, vegetable oil, cocoa, candles, cigarettes, soaps and many more items wholesale

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda is a 25-year-old engaged woman. She's living with her parents and two siblings. Her fiancée has owned a mobile shop for the past four years. In 2007, he joined the military and as a result, she has taken over all the responsibilities of the shop. She's trying to help her fiancée provide better living conditions and get married next year. She sells mobile phones, mobile accessories and rechargeable cards. 

Today, Amanda is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a big quantity of merchandise needed at good prices to fill her shop.

loans.use: To buy a big quantity of merchandise needed in good prices

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Pictured here is Marie K., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This woman is seeking a loan of SLL 2,500,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time in order to expand her business, make more sales, and consequently improve her standard of living. 

Marie K. is 42 years old, a widow with 4 children all of whom are now grown-ups and on their own. Marie was born in Makeni and has been a businesswoman for 6 years now. She sells "gara lappers" (locally dyed cloth) and rice. With the help of this loan, she will buy gara-lapper-making materials – white cotton, ink, caustic soda, etc., and pay experts to make designs on the white cotton. She will also use some of the loan to buy bags of rice.

loans.use: Buy "gara lapper" making materials – white cotton, ink, caustic soda, etc., and bags of rice

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 30-year-old married woman. A mother of two young children, she started working as a home-based hairdresser in 2004 to help her husband raise their children. Her occupation allows her to be useful to her family and she's happy with that. 

Today, Rania is requesting to borrow $1,000 because she's planning to enlarge her business by buying more hairdressing tools and products requested by her clientele. In addition, she hopes that she will be able, in the coming months, to open her own hairdressing shop.

loans.use: To buy more hairdressing tools and products

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.ru: Нарзулоев Насрулло проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 37 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Насрулло более 10 лет занимается торговлей. У него магазин со смешенным ассортиментом. Он продает каляски, игрушки и вещи для дома. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. Насрулло хочет расширить свой бизнес. Он намерен открыть еще один магазин.
texts.en:
Nasrullo N. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 37 years old, married and has 5 children. His wife is a homemaker. Nasrullo has been involved in retail sales for over 10 years. He has a store, where he sells various merchandise, including baby carriages, toys and home goods. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover. Nasrullo wants to expand his business. He intends to open another store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a 43-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has been working in clothing sales for the past 10 years. In 2008, she opened her own clothing shop to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is thankful for her business income; it allows her to take care of her old parents. 

Today, Najwa is asking to borrow $1,000 to expand her inventory for the summer season and before the coning holidays to increase her sales and make good revenue.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline sells plastics like plates, bowls, cups and spoons at retail prices. She hopes to expand her business and hopes to be a major plastics distributor in her city in the future. She loves her business because it is highly profitable to her.

Roseline is 39 years old and married to a teacher. Her children attend school and they are making progress at school.

Roseline hopes for a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more plastics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders in anticipation of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics goods to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a friendly and a hardworking woman who sells medicines at retail prices in Ibadan. She has been in this business for a long time and uses her years of experience in business to attract and retain more customers. She hopes to expand her business.

Esther hopes for a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She is 35 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a photographer and he also supports their home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Esther has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Tamasyor Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Tamasyor' group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. Consequently, they will make more sales and better profit. As their profit-to-sales-margin increases, they will better support themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Sallay K., pictured on the right. Sallay was born in Kono, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. She is age 33. She is married to a businessman and they have 3 children – one in secondary school and two in primary school. Sallay sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). She has been selling palm oil for 4 years now. Sallay will use her share of the loan to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: Bahlul

texts.en:
Bahlul A. is 50 years old. He is married and has three children. A.'s family lives in Fuzuli region.

A. has been in this business for six years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy 20 speeps to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy 20 sheeps

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 55-year-old woman and the mother of five children who are between the ages of 20 and 32 years.

To make a living, Dorcas sells frozen food like fish and chicken and also sells sarongs in Lagos State. She opens her shop every day of the week. Her greatest joy is been able to support and assist her husband, who is a carpenter, financially and ensure that the family’s needs are met. She hopes to expand her business in future.

Dorcas is requesting a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more frozen food to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en:
Abiola is a businesswoman and is hardworking. She sells drinks at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because she does not sell on credit and so she does not incur debt in her business. She hopes to own a drink company in the future.

Abiola is a friendly and happy woman. She uses her friendly nature to attract and retain more customers to her business. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.

Abiola is married with six children and she is 50 years old. Her children are excelling in school and business. She is also a grandmother and this makes her happy and proud of her grandchildren. Her husband sells blocks to also support the home.

Abiola has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Youngest Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Youngest Group'. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 2,300,000 to enable them to further strengthen their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. Consequently, they will make more sales and better profit. As their profit-to-sales-margin increases, they will better support themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Zainab C., pictured second from right. Zainab was born in Makeni city. She is age 30, married with 4 children – 2 in secondary school and 2 in primary school. Zainab has been selling slippers/flip-flops for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy dozens of slippers and in wide variety.

loans.use: Buy dozens of slippers/flip-flops in wide variety

loans.name: Maluku Cell A. Zemeyi Florence Group

texts.en:
Z. Florence is the President of Maluku Cell Group; she is a hardworking business lady, twenty-eight years old. She is married and blessed with two children who are schooling.

Florence owns a restaurant and her business is one year old. She is using the loan to purchase foodstuffs (cassava, sweet potatoes, bananas, sugar, salt, and so forth) for her business. She is a promising business lady who is looking forward to the expansion of her business and to a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her restaurant business

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en:
Bosede sells household items like cups, plates, pots and plastics at retail prices. She hopes to expand her business and to become a major distributor of household items in her city in the future. She loves her business because it is highly profitable to her.

Bosede is married to a civil servant and they have three children. Her children attend school and they are making progress at school.

Bosede hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more household items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders in anticipation of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more household items to sell

loans.name: Holmirzo

texts.ru: Мадаминов Холмирзо проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 64 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Холмирзо имеет среднее образование. Более 7 лет занимается живоноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Этот бизнес приносит ему хороший доход. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Holmirzo M. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 64 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Holmirzo has a secondary education. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 7 years. He breeds cattle at home and primarily raises and sells livestock. This business yields him a good income. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Zakirova Elmira`s Group

texts.ru:
Закирова Эльмира, 45 лет, и она замужем. Ее супруг в данное время находится на заработках в России. Он каждый месяц отправляет по 200 долларов для семьи. У нее 4 детей, все достаточно большие и постоянно помогают маме при ведении хозяйства. У клиента есть пара дойных коров, от которых она получает молоко и производит кисло-молочные продукты. Кредит будет использован для закупа телят для последующего выращивания. 

Представляем вам очередного участника этой группы - Закиров Жайлообек, ему 32 года. Женат и воспитывает 4 детей: троих старших сыновей и младшую дочь. Его супруга в данное время занята воспитанием детей, а также помогает по домашнему хозяйству.  Клиент с 1994 года занимается животноводством. В основном он держит КРС, а также продает молоко и молочные продукты в Узгене. Кредит будет использован для закупа КРС для последующей отправки на пастбище. Недавно он построил для своей семьи новый дом, однако осталось внутренние работы. Надеется что в течение текущего года ему удастся все закончить и переселится в новый дом.   

Айпери ей всего лишь 20 лет. Но она очень ответственная и целеустремленная девушка.  Она проживает вместе со своими родителями и активно помогает при выращивании сельскохозяйственных культур, таких как, кукуруза, пшеница, подсолнух и картофель. После развала СССР семья клиента получила земельный надел размером 1.2 га и с тех пор занимаются этим делом. Кредит будет использован для закупа семяна и удобрения (азот).

Ибраимовой Айзат 24 года. Она красивая молодая девушка, работает в городской архитектуре г. Узген, секретарем-кассиром. Ее зарплата составляет около 100 долларов. По образованию она экономист и мечтает сделать карьеру в одном из финансовых институтов Кыргызстана, благо у нее есть все качества для этого. Кредит будет использован для потребительских нужд. 



--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Elmira Z. is 45 years old and married. Her husband is currently working in Russia. He sends 200 dollars to the family every month. Elmira has 4 children, all of whom are fairly grown and always help their mother with keeping up the household. The client has a pair of dairy cows that she gets milk from and makes dairy products. The loan will be used for the purchase of calves for subsequent growth. Let us present the next participant of this group – Jayloobek Z., who is 32 years old. He is married and is raising 4 children: three older sons and the youngest daughter. His wife is currently raising the children and also helping with the household business. The client has been involved in animal husbandry since 1994. He primarily keeps cattle and also sells milk and dairy products in Uzgen. Jayloobek will use the loan for the purchase of cattle to be sent off to pasture. He recently purchased a new house for his family, however, still has to finish some interior work for it. He hopes that he will be able to finish all the work and move into the new house over the course of this year. Ayperi is only 20 years old. She is a very responsible and goal-oriented young woman. She lives with her parents and actively helps them with growing agricultural products, such as corn, wheat, sunflower and potato. After the fall of the USSR, the client’s family received a 1.2 hectare plot of land and has been involved in agriculture since then. The loan will be used for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers. Ayzat I. is 24 years old. She is a beautiful young woman, who works as a secretary-cashier at the Uzgen city architecture. Her salary is around 100 dollars. She is educated as an economist and dreams to have a career at one of the financial institutes in Kyrgyzsta, and has all the qualities for this. The loan will be used for consumer needs.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calves

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen T. is 28 years old and lives in Kapan. He is married and has a two-year-old son.

For about six years Armen has managed his own café where he serves his clients and also takes orders for meal preparation without home delivery.

Armen wants to increase the number of his clients, so he decided to increase the area of his café. Now he needs 350,000 AMD to roof a new area of his café.

loans.use: To roof a new area of his café

loans.name: Primberdieva Akbermet`s Group

texts.ru:
Примбердиева Акбермет является лидером данной группы. Группа состоит из 4 участников. Это их первый кредит в МБФ. 

Акбермет 33 года, она замужем. Ее супруг оказывается услуги транспортных перевозок по маршруту Узген-Бишкек-Узген, поэтому из-за специфики работы, он много времени проводит в столице нашей республики. Вместе с мужем Акбермет воспитывает 4 детей. Самому старшему 9 лет, а младшему 1 годик. Она занимается розничной реализацией детской одежды с арендованной точки на центральном рынке Узгена. Хотя она начала этот бизнес в 2009 году, за счет хороших предпринимательских навыков, она в данное время получает стабильный доход, достаточный чтобы, достойно содержать семью. Кредит будет использован для закупа детских кофточек, водолазок. 

Замиру 44 года. Он женат и воспитывает 3 детей. Его супруга работает в России в пекарном цехе. Старшая дочь является инвалидом и поэтому постоянно находится дома. Остальные двое детей учатся в старших классах местной школы.  Замир занимается животноводством: откормом и разведением КРС и МРС. В данное в приусадебном хозяйстве держит 7 голов  МРС и  2 голов КРС. Кредит будет использован для закупа 2 голов МРС и ягненком.

Гулмире 36 лет, замужем. У нее есть собственный магазин, который находится в центре родного села. Этим бизнесом она начала заниматься после замужества. В данное время продает широкий спектр товаров, включая продукты питания и одежду. Кредит будет использован для закупа макарон, соли, сигарет, спичек, а также для детского комплекта одежды. 

Динара Рысбаева является последним участником этой группы. Она берет кредит для закупа семян подсолнуха, который будет посажен в собственном участке. Кроме этого ее супруг занимается выращиванием скота, а также в свободное время оказывает услуги перевозок по маршртуту Узген – село Колдук.     


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Akbermet P. is the leader of this group. The group is made of 4 participants. This is their first loan with MBF. Akbermet is 33 years old and married. Her husband provides transportation services on the Uzgen-Bishkek-Uzgen route, and due to the nature of his work, he spends a lot of time in the capital of our republic. Together with her husband, Akbermet is raising 4 children. The oldest is 9 years old, and the youngest is 1 years old. Akbermet is involved in retail sales of children’s clothing at a leased retail outlet on the Uzgen central market. Although, she started this business in 2009, due to the good entrepreneurial knowledge, Akbermet has a stable income, enough to decently support the family. The loan will be used for the purchase of children’s blouses and shirts. Zamir is 44 years old. He is married and raising 3 children. His wife works in Russia at a bakery. The oldest daughter is disabled and always stays at home. The other two children attend a local school. Zamir is involved in animal husbandry: feeding and breeding of cattle and small livestock. Currently, he has 7 heads of small livestock and 2 heads of cows in the household. The loan will be used for the purchase of 2 heads of small livestock and a lamb. Gulmira is 36 years old and married. She owns a store, located in the center of her native village. She started this business soon after she got married. Currently, Gulmira sells a wide variety of merchandise, including food products and clothing. The loan will be used for the purchase of pasta, salt, cigarettes, matches and also children’s clothing sets. Dinara R. is the last participant of this group. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of sunflower seeds to be planted on her own land. Besides this, her husband is involved in raising livestock and also provides transportation services on the Uzgen-Kolduk route.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's clothing

loans.name: Believe In God Iii Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs named their group 'Believe In God III'. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improving their families’ well-being. 

Isatu K., pictured on the right, is the leader of this group. Isatu was born in Makeni about 45 years ago. She is married to a teacher and they have 5 children – 2 in secondary school and 3 in primary school.  For quite a number of years now, Isatu has been selling 'gara lappers' (locally dyed clothes, sometimes with fabricated designs) and cakes. With her share of this loan, she will buy gara-lapper-making materials like ink, caustic soda, white cotton and pay experts to make designs on the cottons.

loans.use: Buy gara lapper making materials like ink, caustic soda, white cotton, and pay experts to make designs on the cottons

loans.name: Maluku Cell A Lidya Mutonyi Group

texts.en:
Lidya M. is a hardworking businesswoman, thirty-two years old, who is married and blessed with three children schooling. She has three dependents schooling, too.

Lidya has owned a beauty salon business for over ten years now. She is using the loan to purchase beauty salon items such as hair chemicals, hair combs, hair shampoos, hair relaxers, and so forth for her work to attract more customers.

Lidya is injecting more capital into her business. Her future hope is to at least construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty salon items

loans.name: Opeoluwa

texts.en:
Opeoluwa loves business and she is recording steady growth in her business. She sells bottles of wine and juice at retail prices to earn a living. The demands for her bottles of wine and juice are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

Opeoluwa lives with her family at Ibadan. She has a child and the child is four years old and attends school. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home. Opeoluwa duly thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bottles of wine and juice to sell

loans.name: Kalamera Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Kalamera' group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. These small-scale businesswomen have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each person in order to expand their businesses in size and quality. In this way, they can make more sales, earn more profit, and consequently improve their families’ well-being.

On the right in the photo is the group’s leader, Rugiatu C.. Rugiatu who was born in Makeni, is age 33, single with 2 children – 1 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. For quite a number of years now, Rugiatu has been selling market food – rice, salt, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), "gari" (cassava grits), etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of rice, 'gari', salt and packets of Maggi cubes.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, 'gari', salt and packets of Maggi cubes

loans.name: Adijat

texts.en: Adijat is a friendly and hard working woman. She designs clothes for her customers. She makes both Nigerian and western designs. Adijat also sells tailoring materials at retail prices to her customers. With these combined businesses, she hopes to support her home. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She is always happy when her customers patronize her stall. She is itching for expansion in her business. She is married with three children. She is 37 years old and her husband works to support their home. She is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells charcoal and eggs. Charcoal is made from burnt wood and very dark in color. It is mainly used for roasting and cooking food. Some people prefer the use of charcoal to firewood. She goes to villages in Lagos State to buy charcoal and sells in the city where she and her family live. She purchases eggs from the poultry farmers and sells at retail prices to her customers at their business place. She is very hard working and determined. She does these businesses with the help of her children. She hopes to help her husband sponsor their children’s education. With the proceeds from her businesses, she can care for her personal and family needs. Comfort is requesting a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more charcoal and eggs to sell.


Comfort is 48 years old, married and has four children who are presently in higher institutions of learning. She appreciates all Kiva lenders for their great support.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Fatoumata Néné

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Fatoumata Néné D. est une jeune commerçante au quartier Cité Niakh Thiès. Elle est âgée de 23 ans et vend le petit déjeuner, le diner et des habits depuis presque deux ans. Elle a héritée ce commerce de sa grande sœur qui lui a légué le business pour aller rejoindre son mari. Cependant Mademoiselle D. qui aidait sa sœur à ce travail pense que les rapports avec la clientèle est la plus importante dans le business.  
Membre de U-IMCEC depuis 2 ans, Mademoiselle D.,  après le prêt qu’elle a soldé il y’a 2 mois, sollicite un prêt de 200 000 FCFA pour s’équiper en robes, chaussures destinées á sa vente. Elle compte avec cet investissement placer à crédit ses produits à sa clientèle qui vont lui régler par fréquences pré-établies pendant la vente. Avec les bénéfices qu’elle espère gagner, Mademoiselle D. compte aider sa maman à la charge de la maison et régler ses propres.
texts.en:
Miss Fatoumata Néné D. is a young merchant in the Cité Niakh neighborhood of Thiès. She is 23 years old, and has been selling breakfast, lunches and clothing for almost two years. She inherited the business from her elder sister who left it to join her husband. Miss D., who previously helped her sister run the business, believes that customer relations are the most important part of doing business. Miss D. has been a member of U-IMCEC for two years, has finished reimbursing a loan two months ago, and is now requesting a loan for 200,000 FCFA to acquire clothes and shoes for resale. With this investment she intends to offer the option of credit payments to her customers, with a payback frequency established at the time of sale. With her projected earnings, Miss D. will assist her mother with household expenses and take care of her own needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resupply products

loans.name: Maluku Cell A. Amunge Grace Group

texts.en: A. Grace is the group president of Maluku Cell A. She is 40 years old and a strong businesswoman. She is married with six children all in school and she has three dependents in school too. She operates a produce business that she has been carrying out for over six years. Therefore, she is using the loan to purchase produce (cassava) for sale. The loan is encouraging her to work very hard and she is hoping to change her standard of living. Her dreams are to obtain land and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase produce (cassava) for sale.

loans.name: Soladayo

texts.en: Soladayo A. loves sarongs and that is why she sells colorful sarongs and laces. Sarongs are worn in Nigeria by women and young ladies to occasions. Soladayo hopes to own an African boutique in the future and she hopes to sell only Nigerian fabrics. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes for 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more sarongs to sell. She is 40 years old and married with four children. Her eldest child is 18 years old and the youngest child is 6 years old. Her children attend school and this makes her happy. She hopes that they become graduates in the future. Her husband also works to support the home. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Bannineh Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs named their group 'Baninneh'. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their families’ well-being. 

Aminata B., pictured on the right, is the leader of this group. Aminata B. was born in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. She is 35 years old, married to a police officer, and the two of them have four children – three in secondary school and one in primary school. Aminata has been selling market food for more than 11 years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, oil, toothpaste, batteries, etc.

loans.use: Buy Maggi cubes, salt, oil, toothpaste, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Bagdagul

texts.en: Bagdagul A. was born in 1974. She is married and has two children. Bagdagul and her family live in Absheron region. Bagdagul is a teacher at school. Five years ago she started a home tutoring business. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy a new computer to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Marare Nalwogo Kasifa Group

texts.en: Kasifa N. is a businesswoman who is 30 years old and married with three children all in school. She has a retail shop business that she has been operating for two years. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, soap, rice, plastics or utensils, etc for sale. She is a hardworking woman whose future hopes are to obtain land and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, soap, rice, plastics or utensils, etc for sale.

loans.name: Sylvanus A.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from, a secondary school in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown. This school was established in 1925. Currently, the school has 17 teachers. Four of them have applied for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each person from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo, and Kiva lenders. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Sylvanus A. K. (top left) is the head of this group. He has been in the teaching profession for 31 years. He was born in Waterloo, 20 miles from Freetown. He is age 51, married to a businesswoman, and they have 7 children between the ages of 8 and 21. With this loan, Mr. K. will buy house-building materials, bags of cement, for the completion for his house.

loans.use: Buy bags of cement

loans.name: Olamide

texts.en:
41-year-old Olamide lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She buys eggs and sells eggs from the comfort of her home. She goes to poultry farms both far and near in order to get more eggs to sell to her customers and make more profit. 


Olamide is asking for a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more eggs to sell. This, she said, will increase her sales and meet her customers’ high demand. She is married with a child who is in primary school. She helps her husband, a driver, to provide the family's basic needs. She says thanks to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Immah

texts.en:
Immah K. is a 40-year-old woman from Freetown in Sierra Leone. She has four children.

Immah K. sells cooked rice served with potato leaves or cassava leaves. She has been with LAPO, SL for about two years now.

With the help of LAPO, SL and Kiva lenders, Immah K. hopes to use this new loan to expand her business by purchasing more rice, potato leaves and cassava leaves. In addition, it is her dream to use her profits to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, potatoes leaves and cassava leaves

loans.name: Bugwere1 Khainza Leya Group

texts.en: K. Leya is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married and blessed with six children. Two of her children are going to school. She deals with fresh vegetables and she has been selling vegetables for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase fresh vegetables from farms to market for sale. She is a promising businesswoman whose dreams are obtaining land and constructing a good house.

loans.use: To purchase fresh vegetables to sell

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba K. lives in Freetown with her husband and four children. Her husband works as a security guard.

Kumba K. has been in business for ten years, selling watermelons, oranges and plantain. She supports her family with her business. Her desire to break out of the grip of poverty has been the driving force that has taken her through four loans with LAPO, SL. 

With her previous loan Kumba K. expanded her business by purchasing more watermelons, oranges and plantain to sell. She is asking for a loan of 1,500,000 leones to again purchase more watermelons, oranges and plantain. She hopes to realize her dream of educating her children.

loans.use: To purchase more watermelons, oranges and plantain

loans.name: Bugwere 2 Mimuna Nandala Group

texts.en: Kanyago Edith is a businesswoman, 33 years old, single and blessed with four children in school. She has a retail shop business selling charcoal, which she has been doing for over ten years so far. She is using the loan to purchase bags of charcoal from villages to sell at the market place. She is hardworking and her future hope is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Sade

texts.en: Sade is 35 years old and married to a commercial driver. They have four children. Her youngest child is six years old. Her children attend school and they are doing well in school. Her husband is a commercial driver and he supports their home. Sade is a friendly and hardworking woman. She sells cosmetics and baby things like cream, flask and toys. She hopes to own a shopping mall in the future. She is itching for expansion in her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and baby things to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 45 years old. She is a single mother of two children who attend school. She has been selling livestock for five years. She is also employed to earn extra income. She hopes to buy good breeds of goats and cows. She has requested a loan of kes 40,000 to add to her stock of cows and goats. She describes herself as hard-working and social.

loans.use: To buy more livestock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace sells "pap" (ground maize that is soaked and softened into a porridge) from her home. She buys maize in bulk and processes it into pap. She sells the pap to big buyers, who sell it with bean cakes, because people in this locality cherish pap and bean cakes for their breakfast. She gets her maize directly from the farmers. When corn becomes scarce, she travels far to make sure her customers are supplied. She has been in this business for eleven years.

Grace is 40 years old and a widow. She has three children whose age ranges between 12 to 21 years. With part of her profit, she is able to clothe, feed, and pay the school fees of her two younger children who are still in secondary school.

Grace is requesting for a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase maize in bulk to make pap to sell. She says "thank you" and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 30-year-old mother of three children who attend school. She has been distributing eggs and cakes wholesale for nine years. She dreams of driving her own vehicle in the future. She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to increase her stock of eggs and cakes. She describes herself as hard-working and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy more eggs

loans.name: Folake

texts.en:
Folake sells plastics, including baskets and kegs. She has been in this trade for many years. She also has a shop where she sells and rents video compact discs. 

She is requesting a loan of NGN 120,000 to buy plastics in bulk from the factory to sell. She said this will reduce her costs, including the cost of transporting the goods to market, and increase her profit. She will be able to serve her clients better and also assist her husband, who is a clergyman, to keep and care for their home.

Folake is 40 years old and married, and she has four children. She and her family lives in Lagos State. She expresses her gratitude to all lenders.

loans.use: To buy plastics in bulk to sell

loans.name: Nike

texts.en:
Nike is a friendly and a hard-working woman. She has a good relationship with LAPO. Nike sells medicines at retail prices in Ibadan. She hopes to expand her business. Nike is hoping for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She is 38 years old and married. She has a 15-year-old child who attends school. Her husband works and supports their home. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

About LAPO:
LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Ganiyu

texts.en: Ganiyu sells motor spare parts at retail prices. With this business, he hopes to put food on his table to feed his children. He is happy about his business because he is the only man in this business in his community. He hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. He is itching for progress in his business. He is 55 years old and married with 5 children. His wife sells goats to help support their home. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Victoria es soltera y tiene 52 años, Victoria vende ropa variada y cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares. Además Victoria prepara queques y humitas a pedidos.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, vainilla y canela.
El sueño de Victoria es tener un cafetín en un lugar céntrico.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Kuskanchik communal bank. Kuskanchick means "Together" in Quechua. Victoria is single and is 52 years old. She sells a variety of clothing and cosmetics through catalogs which she offers to friends and relatives. She also makes cakes and humitas (a Peruvian version of a tamale) by special order. Victoria needs a loan of 900 soles to be invested in the purchase of sugar, vanilla and cinnamon. Victoria's dream is to have a small café in a downtown location.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, vanilla and cinnamon

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Eugenia es viuda, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Eugenia tiene un puesto en el mercado Mariscal Caceres en donD. venD. abarrotes en general y cereales, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar.
El sueño D. Eugenia son tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Kuskanchik Communal Bank. Kuskanchik means “All Together” in Quechua. Eugenia is a 50 year old widow with 4 children. She has a stall in the Mariscal Caceres Market where she sells groceries and grain on a daily basis. Eugenia needs a loan of 1000 soles with which she would buy rice and sugar. Eugenia's dream is to have a home based shop.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is a friendly and hard-working woman. She designs clothes for her customers. She makes both Nigerian and western designs. She also sells tailoring materials at retail prices to her customers. With these combined businesses, she hopes to support her home. 

Blessing hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She is always happy when her customers patronize her stall. She is itching for expansion in her business. She is married with 4 children. She is 39 years old and her husband works to support the home. Her children are excelling in school. She is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Maria Evangelista

texts.es:
En el Cantón Montecristi se reúne el Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés cuenta con 19 prestatarias,  sus habitantes se dedican  a elaborar artesanías a base de mimbre y paja toquilla que en su gran mayoría son exportadas a diferentes países del mundo.

La señora Maria Evangelista se dedica a la venta de artesanía en paja toquilla y muebles para el  hogar, ella compra en Montecristi a los distribuidores y entrega en Guayaquil donde tiene sus clientes fijos y vende bajo pedidos, nuestra socia aprovecha el viaje a Guayaquil y comprar mercadería como ropa, bisutería y utensilio de cocina.

 ella  empezó su negocio hace 25 años motivada por su familia,  aprendió de  negocios y desde entonces no ha dejado de trabajar ya se adaptado a viajar los jueves Guayaquil desde hace 22 años, al ser consultada que porque decidió trabajar en Guayaquil nos cuenta porque hay mucha competencia en el lugar donde ella vive. 

Con este nuevo prestamo nuestra socia invertirá en artesanías y mercadería como  sillas, juegos de comedor, ,mecedores de mimbre y faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas, zapatos para su otro negocio, al preguntarle como le va con las ventas nos comentó que en esta época han bajado y que las ganancias son pocas, para la señora Maria trabajar con la Fundación le ha favorecido mucho porque su negocio se ha ido incrementado.
texts.en:
The community bank Banco Comunal San Andrés gathers to meet in the district of Montecristi. The group has 19 borrowers. It's members make artisanal goods from wicker, as well as straw (or "Panama") hats, the majority of which are exported to different countries throughout the world. Señora Maria Evangelista works in selling artisanal goods such as Panama hats and furniture for the home. She purchases goods from the distributors in Montecristi, and brings them to Guayaquil, where she has regular customers who place orders with her. Maria Evangelista takes advantage of the trip to Guayaquil by purchasing merchandise such as clothing, costume jewelry, and kitchen utensils along the way. She began her business 25 years ago, when her family motivated her to learn about business, and since then she has not ceased to work. 22 years ago, she adapted her work routine to include a trip every Thursday to Guayquil, doing so, she tells us, because there was so much competition working in the place where she lived. With this new loan she will invest in more artisanal goods and merchandise for her to sell, including chairs, games, straw rocking chairs, and clothing such as skirts, blouses, pants, shirts, and shoes. When asked how her sales are doing, she tells us that lately they have gone down, and that her earnings are few. None the less, for Maria Evangelista, working with the Fundación has been very good for her, because it has helped her to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar sillas, juegos de comedor, mecedores en mimbre y faldas, blusas, camisas,zapatos para abastecer sus negocios

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Amanda es casada, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos, Amanda tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende verduras, además Amanda en su casa tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
Amanda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y arroz.
Los sueños de Amanda son surtir con mas productos su tienda y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Amanda is a member of the Kuskanchik Communal Bank. “Kuskanchik” means “all together” in Quechua. Amanda is married and 54 years old with 3 children. She has a stall in the April 12 Market where she sells vegetables. In addition, Amanda has a grocery shop in her house.

Amanda needs a loan of 900 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of sugar and rice. Amanda dreams are to stock her shop with more products and that her children will work in professions.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sugar and rice

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Saturnina es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Saturnina vende discos y DVD de músicas productos que reparte al por mayor a diferentes tiendas.
Saturnina necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de discos.
Saturnina sueña con mejorar su negocio y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Saturn is a member of the Kuskanchik Communal Bank. Kuskanchik means “All Together” in Quechua. Saturn is 31 and has 2 children with her partner. She sells music CD’s and DVD’s which are distributed in bulk to different stores. Saturn needs a loan of 1230 soles to invest in the purchase or more music discs. Saturn dreams of her business improving and having her own grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more music discs.

loans.name: Aquelina

texts.es:
Aquelina es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Aquelina es casada, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Aquelina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Aquelina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz y fideo.
Los sueños de Aquelina son tener una ferretería y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aquelina is a member of the communal bank "Kuskanchik" which means "All Together" in Quechua. Aquelina is married, 35 years old, and has three children. Aquelina has a store in her house where she sells vegetables and general groceries. She works every day. Aquelina needs a loan of 600 soles to invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, and pasta. She would love to have a hardware store one day and provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, and pasta.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Rayda es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Rayda vende cosméticos por catalogo que ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayor parte de sus ventas son al crédito. Además Rayada vende otros productos por campaña.
Rayda necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuadernos.
El sueño de Rayda es tener una empresa de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Rayda is a member of the communal bank "Kuskanchik" which means "All Together" in Quechua. Rayda is married, 35 years old, and has four children. Rayda sells cosmetics by catalog to her family and friends. Most of her sales are on credit. Rayada also sells other products by campaign. Rayda needs a loan of 600 soles to invest in the purchase of notebooks. Rayda's dream is to have a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy notebooks.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy sells foodstuffs like beans, corn, tomatoes, peppers, 'gari' (cassava couscous), rice and yam flour. She buys these in large quantity and sells them retail. She is very hard-working and on days she is to stock up her shop, she leaves home as early as 5AM to be able to get goods. She has been in business for five years, and with this business she has been able to help her husband in providing for the family.

She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase foodstuffs in bulk at a better discount for resale. Mercy is 42 years old, married, and has six children. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in bulk to resell

loans.name: Oluwafemi

texts.en:
Oluwafemi is a friendly and a hard-working woman. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization).  LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. 

Oluwafemi sells medicines and groceries at retail prices in Ibadan. She hopes to own a maternity home in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She is 35 years old and married with 3 children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. Her husband sells beef to support their home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Luis Emilio

texts.es: El Señor Luis Emilio tiene la edad 47 años. La actividad económica de Don Luis es la venta de productos lácteos, pues es una manera de sufragar los gastos de su familia. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por que la mayoría de sus vecinos compraban leche, pero la persona que se las ofrecía, no se las proporcionaba a un precio favorable ademas el la vende en un humilde carreton en donde tranporta su leche, cuajada, crema entre otros productos. Es por eso Luis se empeña es obtener este medio de vida para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Es por eso que siente la necesidad de acudir a un financiamiento con el objetivo de invertirlo en capital de trabajo que es necesario en su negocio. Su deseo es obtener otro medio de ingreso que le ayude.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Emilio is 47 years old. Don Luis sells milk products since this is a way to take care of his family's expenses. He has had this business for more than ten years. He got started in this because most of his neighbor's bought milk, but the person selling it didn't give them a good price. In addition, he sells it from a humble cart he transports his milk, curd, cream and other products on. Don Luis does this sort of work to improve his living conditions. He feels the need to ask for a loan so he can invest it in the working capital necessary for his business. He would like to find another way of earning an income to help him out.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Bolaji

texts.en:
Bolaji bakes cakes and other pastries. She has been in this business since 2004. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Bolaji is a hard-working woman and she is so determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more catering materials to boost her business. 

Bolaji is 37 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband sells planks to support the household. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more catering materials

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Rocio es soltera y tiene 20 años, Rocio vende ropa en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad, productos que compra en la ciudad de Lima, Rocio junto a su mama tienen un taller de confecciones.
Rocio necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas para camisas.
Los sueños de Rocio es terminar su carrera de Ingeniería Agrícola y ayudar a su mama en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rocio is a member of the Solidaridad Communal Bank. Rocio is 20 years old and single. Rocio sells clothes at the different fairs in the city. She buys the products in the city of Lima. Rocio and her mother have a seamstress shop. Rocio needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy fabric for shirts. Rocio’s dreams are to finish her Agricultural Engineering studies and to help her mother with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric for shirts

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es:
Marisabel es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Marisabel es conviviente y tiene 29 años, Marisabel tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su pareja.
Marisabel necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles escolares.
El sueño de Marisabel es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marisabel is a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad” (Solidarity). She is 29 years old and in a common law marriage. Marisabel has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat. She manages her business every day with the help of her partner.

She needs a loan of 1000 PEN in order to buy school supplies. Marisabel dreams of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Irene es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Irene viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, papa, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Irene necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Los sueños de Irene son tener casa propia e implementar su negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad” (Solidarity). She is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Irene travels to different fairs in the region to buy grains, potatoes, and other products that she sells at the local food market.

She needs a loan of 1600 PEN in order to buy potatoes. Irene dreams of having her own house and starting a home business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin sells drinks and also supplies mattresses to schools on demand, and she has been in this trade for many years. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to buy more drinks from the factory to sell. This, she said, will reduce her cost price and transportation to market and increase profit. She runs these businesses with the support of her husband who sometimes assists her despite his busy schedule. With these combined businesses, she could make more profit to keep up her household.
 
Toyin is 39 years old, married with two children, and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She expresses her great thanks to you lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Raquel es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hija, Raquel vende ropa y loceria variada a pedido,  productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares la mayoría de sus ventas son al crédito.
Raquel necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mochilas y ropa.
Los sueños de Raquel son que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Raquel is a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad” (Solidarity). She is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a daughter. Raquel sells clothing and various types of china upon request. Her products are offered to friends and relatives, and the majority of her sales are made on credit.

She needs a loan of 1600 PEN in order to buy backpacks and clothing. Raquel dreams of building a house and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase backpacks & clothing

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Doris es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hija, Doris tiene un puesto alquilado en el mercado chorro en donde vende carne, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Doris necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos.
Doris sueña con construir su casa, sus hijos sean profesionales y ser mayorista de carne.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad” (Solidarity). She is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a daughter. Doris has a rented space at the Chorro Market where she sells meat every day.

She needs a loan of 1800 PEN in order to buy pigs. Doris dreams of building a house, seeing her children become professionals, and becoming a meat wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: Yanis Mercedes

texts.es: Yanis tiene 34 años de edad, no es el primer financiamiento que ha solicitado con Fundación León 2000, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por pagar sus cuotas a tiempo. Su actividad económica es una tienda en general, por lo que tiene más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ella inicio porque quería encontrar la manera de ayudar a su Mama, pero después de obtener cierta experiencia. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos. Su deseo es mejorar sus ingresos para seguir manteniendo a sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Yanis is 34 years old. This is not the first time she has requested a loan from Fundación León 2000, since she has always been concerned about making her payments on time. For more than eight years, she has been managing a general store. After gaining some experience, Yanis decided to start this business because she was looking for ways of supporting her mother. She is requesting a loan to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. Her desire is to increase her earnings so that she can continue supporting her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of ginger for cultivation

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is 36 years old, married and has a child aged 6 years. She sells 'fairly used' clothes and has been in business for the past three years. She is focused on making sure she meets the demand of her customers, which she said will also lead to increase in profit. She wants to expand the size of her business and improve her living standard.

Suzan is asking for a loan of NGN 100,000 to buy more 'fairly used' clothes to sell as this will enable her to get a better discount and make more profit on each sale. She promises to pay back promptly and says thank you to all lenders.

loans.use: To buy more 'fairly used' clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of portable telephones and accessories

loans.name: Maria Helena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene más de 5 años de ser cliente de Fundación, por lo que en todo este tiempo ha logrado aprovechar sus financiamientos con el objetivo de mejorar su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que tiene 7 años de mantener activo este negocio, que implica levantarse temprano, conversar con sus clientes y comprar sus productos, algo de lo que Maria está acostumbrada pues su trabajo forma parte de su vida. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de lápiz labial, joyas, perfumes, ropa en general y calzado. Su deseo es mejorar cada día con la atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Elena has been a client of the Foundation for over five years. In all of that time she has used the loans to improve her business. She sells general merchandise, and she has kept this business going for seven years. She needs to get up early, talk with her customers, and buy her products. These are things that Maria is used to because her work is part of her life. She is asking for this loan to buy lipstick, jewelry, perfume, general clothes, and footwear. Her wish is to everyday improve the service she gives her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lipstick, jewelry, perfume, general clothes, and footwear

loans.name: Konie

texts.en:
This is Konie C.. She is 50 years old and a widow who lives with her children in Tegbeh town in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. Konie has six children: two boys and four girls, three of whom are in college and the last three are in the secondary school.

Konie sells palm oil, pepper, tomatoes, salt, and matches in Tegbeh town market. She has been a client of LAPO, SL for over two years now as a member of a credit union (a loan group that serves as collateral and guarantor for LAPO, SL clients). She has taken four previous loans since joining. With her previous loans she bought the same types of goods for sale and uses the profit to support her children's education.

This time, Konie is seeking a loan of 1,500,000 leones to enable her to buy a deep freezer for the sale of cold drinks to add to her previous business and to make good profits that will change her life and that of her family forever.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory and a deep freezer for cold drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish to sell wholesale and retail

loans.name: Finah

texts.en:
This is Finah T.. She is 42 years old and is married with three children, all of them girls. She lives with her husband and children in Tegbeh town, an area of Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. The first child is in the secondary school and the other two children are in the primary school.

Finah sells her slippers, plates and water in Tegbeh town market and has been a LAPO, SL client for over two-and-a-half years now as a member of a credit union (a loan group that serves as collateral and guarantor for LAPO, SL clients). She has taken out four previous loans since she joined. With her previous loans she added to her inventory by buying the same goods for sale.

Finah, with this new loan of 1,500,000 leones, plans to buy more goods and use her profit to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more plates, slippers and water to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: House improvement

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isata B. is 60 years old,divorced with two children, both boys. The two children are already working. Isata lives in Tegbeh town, an area of Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone.

Isata sells rice, groundnuts, pepper and onions in Tegbeh town market and has been a LAPO, SL client for over two years now as a member of a credit union (a loan group that serves as collateral and guarantor for LAPO, SL clients). She has taken out four previous loans since she joined. With her previous loans she bought the same goods for sale and used her profits to pay her children's school fees.

Isata wants to use her present loan of 1,500,000 leones to buy more of her goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more rice, groundnuts, pepper and onions

loans.name: Ebubedike

texts.en:
Ebubedike is 42 years old, married and has five children. She is a client of LAPO Microfinance and has been borrowing for the past four years. Ebubedike sells 'fairly used' bags and has been in this business for some years. Before she started this trade, she sold foodstuffs. She said sale of 'fairly used' bags is more profitable for her. 

Ebubedike is full of life and hard work. She makes sure there is no lack in her home – food, clothing and more. She is requesting the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more 'fairly used' bags to sell. She promises to pay back promptly and says thank you to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more 'fairly used' bags to sell

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata B. is 53 years old, is married with five children, and lives with her family in Tegbeh town, Freetown. The oldest three children are in secondary school and the last two children are in primary school.

Fatmata sells milk, sugar, butter and toothpaste in Tegbeh town market and has been a LAPO, SL client for over two years. She is a member of a credit union (loan group) in LAPO, SL and has taken four previous loans since she joined. With her previous loans and profits she bought the same type of goods for sale.

Fatmata wants to use her present loan of 1,500,000 leones to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more milk, sugar, butter and toothpaste to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of weed-killer

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
This is Yeabu C.. She is 29 years old and is married with two children: two boys. She lives with her family in Tegbeh town, an area in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra leone. The first child is in nursery school and the last is a baby.

Yeabu sells fish, vegetable oil, onions and canned tomatoes in Tegbeh town market and has been a LAPO, SL client for sometime now. She is a member of a credit union (a loan group that serves as both collateral and guarantor for LAPO, SL clients). She has taken four previous loans with which she expanded her shop with the same types of goods and used the profits for her child's school fees.

This time, Yeabu is seeking a loan of 1,500,000 leones to enable her buy more goods to fill her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more fish, vegetable oil, onions and canned tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase general food products

loans.name: Salvadora Patricia

texts.es: Doña Patricia S. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, poco a poco ha ido creciendo en su negocio el cual consiste en la elaboración y venta de repostería la cual la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación donde ha luchado en conjunto con sus cinco hijos para salir adelante. Tiene dos años de trabajar con ceprodel donde le han otorgado tres créditos para la compra de materiales de construcción con el objetivo de terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Patricia S. is from the town of El Sauce. Gradually, she has been expanding her business which consists of making and selling confections. Her business is located in her home. Patricia has fought together with her five children to get ahead. She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and she received three loans which she has used to purchase construction materials with the objective of finishing construction on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, sand, doors and windows.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto Carlos es originario del municipio de El Sauce, su negocio consiste en brindar servicio de traslado a los pobladores de dicho municipio por medio de un tricitaxi donde tiene dos años de tener su negocio. Ha tenido tres créditos con Ceprodel los que le han beneficiado, ya que gracias a este capital ha podido adquirir estos bienes para trabajar por cuenta propia y salir adelante con el objetivo de brindar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos is from El Sauce. He provides transportation services to residents of this town with a rickshaw; he has been in this line of work for 2 years. He has had three loans with Ceprodel that have been useful for him because he has been able to buy these assets to work independently and get ahead; the objective being to provide a better standard of living for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw.

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Of The Sixth Of May (Banco Mujer Seis De Mayo) Group

texts.en:
The Sixth of May Women’s Bank (Banco Mujer Seis De Mayo) is a group of women from San Martin, Limón; a rural region located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. The women of this group are engaged in productive activities including retail sales and the rearing and selling of livestock (poultry products). 

This loan will be used by the group members to further the development of their individual productive activities. Specifically, the money will be used to finance the purchase of retail products (which will be sold at a later date) such as clothing, bags, shoes, jewellery and underwear. This loan will also be used to purchase livestock (chickens) and animal feed. 

San Martin is a rural region with few employment opportunities. As a result, the women of this group have taken it upon themselves to create work.  The members of this group have a desire to succeed in their businesses and to provide a better standard of living for themselves and their families. 

For the women engaged in sales, a difficulty they have faced is fluctuating market prices for their products. Likewise, individuals involved in the rearing and sale of chickens have encountered obstacles such as high prices for animal feed and low market prices for poultry products.  

Aidali G. Aporta is the president of this group. This will be her first loan with Fundación Mujer. Aidali makes her living by selling various products from door to door in her community. She will use this loan to puchase products to be sold at a later date at a profitable price.

loans.use: For the purchase of livestock, animal feed, and retail products

loans.name: Yessenia Carolina

texts.es: La Sra. Yessenia R. es madre de tres niños, ella trabaja en conjunto con su esposo en el cual el negocio consiste en el alquiler de tricitaxis para brindar servicio de transporte a los pobladores del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente tienen seis años de tener su propio negocio y gracias a los tres créditos que han obtenido con ceprodel han adquirido alrededor de seis tricitaxis, lo que les ha permitido obtener mayores ingresos y brindar un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos. El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de dos tricitaxis.
texts.en:
Yessenia R. has three daughters. She and her husband work leasing rickshaws to provide transportation services to residents of El Sauce. They have been in this line of work for 6 years and, thanks to the three loans from Ceprodel that they have gotten, they have purchased 6 rickshaws. This has made it possible for them to earn higher income and provide a better standard of living for their children. They will use the funds to buy two rickshaws.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two rickshaws.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Ana Julia es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como promotora de cultura y deportes en la Alcaldía de El Sauce donde promueve a los jóvenes a participar en actividades culturales. Actualmente tiene año y medio de laborar en este cargo. Este es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel el que será invertido en la compra de ladrillos, cemento, zinc y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de una pequeña cocina en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Ana Julia is from El Sauce. She is a Sports and Culture promoter for the city of El Sauce where she encourages youngsters to participate in cultural activities. She has had this job for a year and a half. This is her first loan with Ceprodel. It will be used to buy building materials and supplies like: bricks, cement, zinc metal sheeting and to pay labor costs to build a small kitchen in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: The Women’S Bank Of The Sixth Of May (Banco Mujer Seis De Mayo) 2 Group

texts.en:
The Sixth of May Women’s Bank (Banco Mujer Seis De Mayo) 2 is a group of women from San Martin, Limón; a rural region located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. The women of this group are engaged in productive activities including bread-making and the rearing and selling of livestock (poultry products). This loan will be used by the group members to further the development of their individual productive activities. Specifically, the money will be used to finance the purchase of ingredients and raw materials necessary to bread-making such as flour. Additionally, this loan will be used to purchase livestock (chickens) and animal feed. 

San Martin is a rural region with few employment opportunities. As a result, the women of this group have taken it upon themselves to create work.  The members of this group have a desire to succeed in their businesses and to provide a better standard of living for themselves and their families. The women who produce bread have the goal of one day owning a bakery. The women involved in animal rearing hope to use this loan to increase their poultry sales.
For the women engaged in bread-making, a difficulty has been high costs for raw materials. Likewise, individuals involved in the rearing and sale of chickens have encountered obstacles such as high prices for animal feed and low market prices for poultry products.

loans.use: For the purchase of livestock, animal feed, and bread-making materials

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La joven María Elena es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente está estudiando el cuarto año de contabilidad, se desempeña como Secretaria en la Alcaldía municipal de El sauce donde tiene un año de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel el cual será invertido en la compra de cerámica, cemento y pago de mano de obra con el fin de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is from the town of El Sauce. Currently, she is studying accounting and is in her fourth year. She works as a secretary at the municipal town hall of El Sauce where she has been working for a year. This is the first loan Maria Elena requests from CEPRODEL. She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of ceramic, cement and to pay for labor for the improvement of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ceramic, cement and to pay for labor for the improvement of her home.

loans.name: Señor De Milagros 2 Group

texts.es: El grupo “Señor D. Milagros” esta representado por la señora Macaria y conformado por 11 miembros 5 varones y 6 mujeres los cuales se caracterizan por ser amigos y conocidos desD. hace tiempo ya que todas residen en el mismo barrio. El señor Andrés es un miembro destacado del grupo ya que se dedica a la albañilería y es un hombre muy trabajador durante el día trabaja en obras grandes con contratistas y en las noches trabaja en pequeñas obras en casas privadas con la ayuda D. sus esposa para poder obtener un mayor ingreso y darles a sus tres niños una mejor calidad D. vida, el vive en alquiler hasta que pueda juntar dinero para comprar un lote y poder tener su propia casa pero para ello le hace falta seguir trabajando para cumplir su sueño, Don Andrés destinara su crédito a la compra D. herramientas para colocar cerámica y poder abarcar mas trabajos con un menor tiempo en la obra. El resto D. los miembros del grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. pollo, venta D. yogurt, venta D. carne y verduras, tienda, carpintería y uno es mecánico. Existe competencia pero los socios son conocidos ya que viven más D. 25 años por la zona y tienen clientes ya establecidos. El destino del financiamiento es para capital D. operaciones e inversión en los negocios D. los clientes ya que a futuro piensan expandirse en el mercado D. donD. están con nosotros. Una gran mayoría cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
Macaria represents the Señor D. Milagros group. It is comprised of 11 members, 5 men and 6 women. They are friends who have known each other for a long time because they all live in the same neighborhood. Andrés is a member who stands out in the group. He is a bricklayer, and he is a very hard-working man. During the day he works on big jobs with contractors, and in the evenings he works on small jobs in private houses. His wife helps him in order to be able to get greater income and give their children a better quality of life. He lives in a rental until he is able to get together the money to buy a lot and have his own house. To do this he needs to keep working to fulfill his dream. Andrés will use the loan to buy tools to put down tiles and be able to do more jobs in less time. The other members of the group work at different commercial activities like selling chicken, selling yogurt, selling meat and vegetables, a store, carpentry, and one member is a mechanic. Competition exists, but the members are well known because they have lived in the area for over 25 years, and they have established customers. The loan is for operating capital and investment in their businesses. In the future they plan to expand in the market from where they are with us. Most of them have experience with communal banks thanks to loans with entities similar to the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Crecer” esta representado por la señora Martha Elvira y conformadas por 12 miembros D. las cuales 2 son varones y el resto mujeres todas se caracteriza por ser muy unido y alegre; La señora Martha Elvira es natural D. la ciudad D.
