Lodovina is a member of the Communal Bank “Azucenas” (Lilies). She is 43 years old, separated from her spouse, and has four children. Lodovina has a vending post at the Carmen Alto Market where she sells clothing and shoes. She also travels to the fairs twice a week.

Lodovina is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN in order to buy lingerie. She dreams of improving her business, increasing her inventory with more products, and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Guadalupe” esta representados por la señora Carmen y conformada por 17 miembros que son padres y madres D. familia, que trabajan  fuerte, para  poder sacar adelante a su familia como es el ejemplo D. la socias destacada la señora Carmen Silvia que se dedica al servicio D. limpieza ya que debe sacar adelante a sus dos hijas sin el apoyo D. un esposo debiendo trabajar desD. las 6 D. la mañana para empresas D. limpieza y en las tardes se dedica a el lavando ropa en casa particulares y en las noches se dedica a la educación D. sus hijas porque su mayor anhelo es poder ver a sus hijas profesionales , pero viendo D. que no logra ahorrar para el futuro D. sus hijas desea realizar una actividad con la venta D. emparedados y hamburguesas los fines D. semana en un parque cercano a su calle y el reto D. los día en la puerta del domicilio donD. resiD. que actualmente es en anticrítico. 

Por otra parte la presidenta que es la señora Carmen se dedica hace 24 años al comercio en general vendidendo todo tipo D. artículos D. acuerdo a la necesidades del mercado, el préstamo ella lo utilizará para adquirir mayor mercadería ya que así se pueden abaratar costos. 

El resto D. los socios se dedica a la venta D. comida, venta D. abarrotes, venta D. pan, venta D. cosméticos y promotoras D. productos D. belleza;  la actividad D. algunos varones del grupo es que son empleados, albañil, moto taxistas y distintas actividades que realizan para poder progresar y cumplir con sus  obligaciones. La  competencia  en respeto  a sus negocios es fuerte, ya que las señoras y caballeros trabajan duro y requiere un esfuerzo y un sacrificio, para obtener un ingreso capaz D. sustentar a sus familias. El crédito lo destinaran para poder surtir sus tiendas y comprar más productos y ofrecer mejores servicios a sus clientes para que a futuro tengan sus negocios con mayores ingresos y una mejor situación económica. Como es un grupo nuevo se les ha dado una capacitación que están satisfechas y contentas D. ser clientes D. Agrocapital  pero algunas D. las socias ya poseen experiencia gracias a créditos similares en otras entidades.
texts.en:
The Guadalupe group is represented by Carmen and maD. up of 17 members, fathers and mothers who work hard to help their families get ahead in life. For example, Carmen Silvia provides cleaning services, and is responsible for supporting her two daughters, since she doesn’t have any help from a husband. She starts working for the cleaning services at 6am each day. In the afternoons, she washes clothing at private homes. In the evenings, she teaches her daughters, because her greatest dream is for them to grow up to be working professionals. However, she has realized that she is unable to save money for her daughters’ future and so has decided to start selling hamburgers and sandwiches on the weekends in a park near the street where she lives. During the week, she will sell hamburgers from the door of her rental home. Carmen, the group's president, has been working in commerce for the past 24 years, and sells different items according to market demand. She will use this loan to acquire to buy bulk merchandise in order to keep her costs down. The other group members sell food, basic grocery items, bread, cosmetics and beauty products. Some of the male group members work as employees, carpenters, motorcycle taxi drivers, and carry out other activities in order to make progress in life and fulfill their obligations. There is a lot of competition within their respective fields, and all of these men and women are self-sacrificing and work hard in order to earn the income they need to support their families. The loan will be used to buy a variety of products for their businesses and improve the services they offer to their customers so that their businesses will generate more income and an improve their respective economic situations. Since this is a new group, they have received a training session and are content and satisfied to be Agrocapital clients. Some of the group members already have experience taking out similar loans from other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Buy bulk merchandise

loans.name: Lola Lourdes

texts.es:
Lola es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Lola es soltera y tiene 29 años, Lola tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general y frutas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama. Además Lola trabaja en una botica.
Lola necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, fideo, arroz.
Los sueños de Lola son tener una casa propia y estudiar otra carrera.
texts.en:
Lola is a member of the Communal Bank “Azucenas” (Lilies). She is 29 years old and single. Lola has a store in her home where she sells groceries and fruit. She manages this business with the help of her mother. Lola also works at a pharmacy.

She is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN in order to buy sugar, noodles, and rice. Lola dreams of having her own home and studying for another career.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, noodles, and rice

loans.name: Mi Fortaleza En Cristo 3 Group

texts.en:
Argelia is the coordinator of her group 'Mi Fortaleza en Cristo' (My Fortress in Christ) 3, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Santiago, a large city known for its tobacco and beef production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her three children.

Argelia is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business making candy by purchasing sugar and coconut. She will use the profits to invest in saving towards her goal of owning a restaurant. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Ingredients to make sweets

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Xiomara R. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como la encargada de la biblioteca de la Alcaldía de El Sauce donde tiene 11 años de laborar en dicho cargo. Ha obtenido seis créditos con Ceprodel los que le han beneficiado porque ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y brindar un mejor nivel de vida  a sus hijos. El crédito que solicita lo requiere para la compra de útiles escolares como libros, bolsos, accesorios y uniformes.
texts.en:
Xiomara R. is from El Sauce. She is in charge of the El Sauce Municipal Library; she has had this job for 11 years. She has had previous loans with Ceprodel and they have been useful to her because she was able to make home improvements and provide her children with a better standard of living. The funds requested now will be used to buy school supplies like: textbooks, bookbags, accessories and school uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Irene es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Irene vende comida de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad, además Irene junto a su esposo tienen una renovadora de calzados.
Irene necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que cera invertido en la compra de plantas de zapatos y tapillas.
Los sueños de Irene son mejorar su negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the communal bank Milenio. She lives with her partner, is 37 and has 3 children. Irene sells food walking around the wholesale food market in the city, and also has a shoe repair business with her husband. Irene needs a loan of 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of shoe soles and heels. Irene's dreams are to improve her business and construct her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoe soles and heels.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.es:
Reynalda es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Reynalda  es casada, tiene 58 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales 2 viven con ella, Reynalda venD. ropas interiores y lencería D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado central D. la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Reynalda necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. interiores y medias.
El sueño D. Reynalda es tener una tienda estable.
texts.en:
Reynalda is a member of the communal bank Milenio. She is married, is 58 years old and has 8 children, 2 of whom live with her. Reynalda sells undergarments and lingerie walking around the central city market, an activity she does every day. Reynalda nees a loan of 2000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of underwear and socks. Reynalda's dream is to have a fixed shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of underwear and socks

loans.name: Los Alegres Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Los Alegres” esta representado por las señora Tatiana y esta conformado por 16 miembros donD. todos se conocen y se apoyan entre todos, pero también se garantizan. La señora Tatiana trabaja desD. muy temprano en la mañana realizando sus compras D. víveres para preparar la comida para medio día y luego empezar a preparar la cena para sus pensionados la socia tiene su domicilio propio con una pequeña sala para atender a sus clientes por lo que requiere el crédito para ampliar su negocio y poder compra mesas mejorando así sus ingresos para poder darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus tres niños que son su razón para seguir adelante su esposo trabaja para una empresa repartidora D. gaseosas y en su tiempo libre ayuda en la pensión D. sus esposa.  El resto D. los socios cuentan con negocios propios algunos en sus domicilios como otros en el mercado, en venta D. empanadas y refrescos, venta D. abarrote, también trabajan D. empleados pero son promotoras.  En realidad la competencia existe en todo lugar pero como grupo ellos tratan siempre D. apoyarse en especial en las ventas D. cosméticos porque ambulan vendiendo sus productos. El crédito lo destinaran para poder surtir sus tiendas y comprar más productos y ofrecer mejores servicios a sus clientes para que a futuro tengan sus negocios con mayores ingresos y una mejor situación económica. Como es un grupo nuevo se les ha dado una capacitación que están satisfechas y contentas D. ser clientes D. Agrocapital  pero algunas D. las socias ya poseen experiencia gracias a créditos similares en otras entidades
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Los Alegres' is represented by Tatiana and is maD. up of 16 members, who all know and support each other, but also guarantee each other. Tatiana works from very early in the morning buying supplies to prepare lunch and later prepares dinner for her guests. Tatiana has her own home with a small dining room where she attends to her customers. She requires a loan to expand her business and to be able to buy tables, improving her earnings in this way and giving a better quality of life to her 3 children, who are her reason for moving forward. Her husband works for a softdrink delivery company and in his spare time he helps his wife with her restaurant. The rest of the members have their own businesses, some in their homes and some in the market, including empanada and drink sales, grocery sales, and some also work as employees (but they are the promoters). In reality competention exists everywhere but as a group they always try to support each other, especially in cosmetic sales, as they sell them door to door. The loan destined for these members is so they can stock their shops and buy more products and offer better services to their customers, so that their businesses have a future with better earnings and they have an improved economic situation. As it is a new group the bank has given them the capacity to be satisfied and content to be Agrocapital clients, but some of the members already possess experience thanks to similar loans from other entities.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es:
Nelva es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Nelva es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Nelva vende ropas interiores y lencería de manera ambulatoria en el mercado central de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días, los días domingos viaja a ferias.
Nelva necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lencería.
Los sueños de Nelva son terminar sus estudios de contabilidad, comprar una casa y que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Nelva is a member of the communal bank Milenio. She lives with her partner, is 28 years old, and has 2 children. Nelva sells underwear and lingerie walking through the city's central market, an activity that she does every day. Sundays she travels to fairs. Nelva is seeking a loan of 2000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of lingerie. Nelva's dreams are to finish studying accounting, buy a house and to see her business prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Justina es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijas, Justina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles escolares.
Los sueños de Justina son implementar un locutorio, sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the communal bank Milenio. She is 36, married and has 2 daughters. Justina has a shop in her house where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat - an activity that she does every day. Justina needs a loan of 1000 soles, money which will be invetsed in the purchase of school supplies. Justina's dreams are to implement a telephone booth, that her daughters become professionals, and to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies

loans.name: Abaroa Okinawa Group

texts.es: El grupo  “Abaroa Okinawa” esta representado por las señora Santa María y conformada 14 miembros la cual son 10 mujeres y 4 son varones. La señora Santa María es emplead D. una industria con el cargo D. envasa y encajona el producto terminado ella es madre D. tres niños que sustenta junto con su esposo, debido a que la empresa actualmente se encuentra modernizando sus maquinarias y ella ve la posibilidad D. que la remplacen por una D. ellas, la señora Santa María desea poder iniciar un puesto D. venta D. refrescos y empanadas en la puerta D. su caso o buscar la posibilidad D. salir a una avenida principal para tener mayor venta, pero para ello requiere D. capital es por esta razón que requiere del préstamo para poder iniciar su negocio nuevo que mientras tanto pueD. funcionar fuera del horario D. trabajo actual. El resto D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. hamburguesa, venta D. pan, venta D. comida, venta D. productos D. cosméticos. La competencia entre las socias es realmente difícil, especialmente en la venta D. comida y en la venta D. cosméticos, ya que cada socia espera cada día un buen resultado en sus ventas. El crédito lo destinaran para poder surtir sus tiendas y comprar más productos y ofrecer mejores servicios a sus clientes para que a futuro tengan sus negocios con mayores ingresos y una mejor situación económica. Como es un grupo nuevo se les ha dado una capacitación que están satisfechas y contentas D. ser clientes D. Agrocapital  pero algunas D. las socias ya poseen experiencia gracias a créditos similares en otras entidades
texts.en:
The “Abaroa Okinawa” group is represented by Santa María and is maD. up of 14 members: 10 women and 4 men. Mrs. Santa María is employed by a firm; she is in charge of the final packing of the finished product. She has three children, who she supports together with her husband. Because the firm she works for is currently modernizing its machinery she thinks that she might be replaced by one of them. She wants to set up a beverage and turnover stand in her doorway or, if possible, set up on one of the town’s main avenues to have better sales. For this to happen, however, she needs capital and this is why she’s asking for a loan to start her new business which, for the time being, she can operate outsiD. her normal employment hours. The rest of the members are involved in various commercial activities like: hamburger sales, bread sales, food sales, cosmetics sales. Competition among them is really difficult, especially in food and cosmetic sales, because every member expects good results from her daily sales. The loan will be used to stock their stores, buy more products and offer better services to their customers so that they will have more income and a better economic situation in the future. As this is a new group, they have received training and they are happy and satisfied to be clients of Agrocapital although some of the members already have experience thanks to similar loans with other entities.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena es una madre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hija de dos años de edad en casa de su suegro, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, un distrito agrícola ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace seis meses, empezó en el negocio animada por una amigas que le comentaron lo rentable de vender cosméticos por catálogo y durante este tiempo ha estado trabajando duro y ya es conocida en la zona. Maria Elena nos comenta que durante los primeros meses tenia que caminar en busca de clientes, ahora lo clientes son los que la van a buscar. 

Aun asi ella no descansa y se ha propuesto ampliar su negocio. Su mayor motivación es la pequeña hija que tiene y el apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia. Su esposo trabaja como obrero de construcción civil y con los ingresos que ambos perciben solventan los gastos familiares y ahorran para poder construir su casa.

María Elena desea adquirir más productos cosméticos para contar con un stock permanente, de manera que sus clientes no esperen el fin de mes (fecha cuando llega el pedido que hacen) para tener los productos que necesitan. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el logro de su objetivo.

Maria Elena es una mujer trabajadora y alegre. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y tener un puesto en el mercado de Cayaltí donde pueda vender sus productos a mas personas.
texts.en:
María Elena, 27, lives with her husband and two-year-old daughter in her father-in-law’s house, which is located in Cayaltí district, an agricultural area an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For the last six months she has sold cosmetics. She started the business encouraged by some friends that told her how profitable selling cosmetics by catalogue could be. During this time, she has been working hard and she is now well-known in the area. María Elena tells us that during the first few months she had to go out searching for potential customers; now it’s the customers that come to look for her. Even so, she does not rest and aims to expand her business. Her greatest motivation is her little daughter and the need to help support her family. Her husband works as a laborer in construction and with both their incomes they are able to meet household expenses and save some to build their house. María Elena wants to get more cosmetics so that she can have permanent stock available and her customers don’t have to wait until the end of the month, which is when her orders are filled, to get the items they need. For this reason, she is calling upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to ask for a 1000 new sol loan which she will invest to reach her goal. María Elena is a hard-working, cheerful woman. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businesswoman and to have a stall in Cayaltí’s market where she can sell her products to more people.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Yerlin Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Yerlin M. es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como Guarda de Seguridad en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene año y medio de laborar. El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de medicinas con el objetivo de mejorar la salud de su mamá.
texts.en:
Yerlin M. is from El Sauce. He has been a security guard for the city of El Sauce for a year and a half. He is asking for funding to buy medicines to improve his mother's health.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for for medical expenses.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Emilia es casada, tiene 46 años y 7 hijos de los cuales 4 viven con ella, Emilia vive en la comunidad de Chiara, tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además se dedica a la agricultura.
Emilia necesita 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles escolares.
Emilia sueña con construir su casa de material noble y tener mas capital para su negocio.
texts.en:
Emilia is a member of the communal bank "Milenio." She is married, 46 years old, and has 7 children, 4 of whom live with her. Emilia lives in the community of Chiara. She has a store in her house that she operates daily where she sells groceries, including vegetables and meat, and general merchandise. She also works in agriculture. Emilia needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to buy school supplies. She dreams of building her own home made of quality materials, and having more capital for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Emilia es casada tiene 49 años y 4 hijos, Emilia tiene un taller D. confecciones D. ropa típica, productos que venD. en los mercados y ferias D. la región.
Emilia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. telas.
Los sueños D. Emilia son construir su casa con material noble e implementar su taller con maquinas modernas.
texts.en:
Emilia is a member of the communal bank "Milenio." She is married, 49 years old, and has 4 children. Emilia has a workshop where she makes traditional Peruvian clothing, which she sells in the markets and fairs in the region. Emilia needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of fabric. Emilia dreams of building her own home with quality materials, and equipping her workshop with modern sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Las Dulces Group

texts.es: Las características del banco comunal  “Las Dulces” esta representadas por la señora Julia  y conformada por 16 miembros  todos residentes de la  misma zona. La señora Julia tiene dos hijos en edad escolar y hace poco su esposo quedo sin trabajo por lo que se vio en la necesidad de trabajar pero como ella no cuenta con ninguna experiencia en otro tipo de trabajos se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos con marcas de Avon, Esika, Yambal y todo lo que se pueda vender a domicilio, vendiendo en el colegio de sus hijos, y empresas privadas donde ya ha conseguido clientela, actualmente su esposo ya consiguió trabajo pero la señora Julia desea seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos a forjar con estudios un mejor futuro es por esta razón que requiere de capital para obtener productos de oferta y llevar directo productos atractivos para sus clientes. El resto de sus compañeras se dedican a la venta de hamburguesa, venta de pan, venta de comida, venta de productos de cosméticos. La competencia entre las socias es realmente difícil, especialmente en la venta de comida y en la venta de cosméticos, ya que cada socia espera cada día un buen resultado en sus ventas. El crédito lo destinaran para poder surtir sus tiendas y comprar más productos y ofrecer mejores servicios a sus clientes para que a futuro tengan sus negocios con mayores ingresos y una mejor situación económica. Como es un grupo nuevo se les ha dado una capacitación que están satisfechas y contentas de ser clientes de Agrocapital  pero algunas de las socias ya poseen experiencia gracias a créditos similares en otras entidades
texts.en:
Julia represents the communal bank "Las Dulces," which is made up of 16 members who all live in the same neighborhood. Julia has 2 school-aged children and recently her husband lost his job, and for this reason she saw the necessity of working. But she did not have any kind of experience, so she began to sell Avon, Esika, Yambal and other brand cosmetics through catalogs from her home, as well as at the school of her children and at private companies where she has gotten customers. Now her husband found work, but Julia wants to keep working to help her sons forge ahead with their education so they can have a better future. For this reason she needs capital to buy products to offer, and to bring appealing products directly to her customers. The rest of her fellow bank members sell hamburgers, bread, meals, and cosmetics. The competition amongst the members is very difficult, especially in the areas of food sales and cosmetics, as each member hopes each day to have a good result with their sales. This loan will be used to restock their businesses with more products, so that they can offer better service to their customers and so that their businesses will provide higher incomes in the future and a better economic situation. As this is a new group, they have been given training, and they are very pleased and content to be clients of Agrocapital. Some of the members already have experience thanks to similar loans from other organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy products to restock their businesses

loans.name: Gladys Piedad

texts.es:
Gladys B. de 50 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es viuda pero tiene 3 hijos ya mayores de edad.

Gladys empezó vendiendo dulces en la esquina de su casa, poco a poco cuando tuvo ingresos suficientes alquilo un local he implemento la venta CD.

Ahora ella tiene una de las tiendas de venta de CD más grandes de su sector, también vende dulces en su negocio. Trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 23h00 todos los días. Una de las complicaciones que ha tenido son las lluvias. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar CD y dulces para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener bien construida su casa y tener otro negocio de venta de CD.
texts.en:
Gladys B., 50, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil; her house is concrete and has all the basic services. She is a widow and has three adult children. Gladys started selling candies on her corner and gradually earned enough income to rent a space and sell CDs. Now, she has one of the largest CD stores in her area; she also sells candies in her store. She is open for business from 6am until 11pm every day. One of the complications she's had are the rains. She will use the loan to buy CDs and candies for her business. In the future, she would like to have her house well built and have an additional store selling CDs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For candies and CDs.

loans.name: Yohana Elizabeth

texts.es:
El banco comunal Haciendo un mundo mejor está integrado por mujeres luchadoras, con una simpatía y carisma muy grande que al momento de las reuniones nos hacen sentir como en familia, todas viven  en la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana; es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

Yohana V.  vive en la urbe de la ciudad en el sector Don Bosco junto a su hermana compartiendo los gastos de  la casa, es oriunda de la provincia de Manabí  hace cinco años se radicaron en esta hermosa ciudad para estudiar y trabajar, es soltera tiene 23 años y trabaja como distribuidora dependiente de los productos Herbalife (productos naturales) en el que lleva  un año y medio, su horario de labores es de 09h00 a 17h30 nos comenta que le va bien  en su trabajo y se siente contenta por ello,  luego del trabajo va a la Universidad Católica de Cuenca  está cursando el segundo año de periodismo.

Es su primer ciclo trabajando con su banco comunal y se siente con mucho optimismo por el apoyo recibido  con el dinero de su crédito  comprará  vitaminas, suplementos alimenticios, proteínas y más productos  Herbalife para tener un stock variado para sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es comprarse un auto.
texts.en:
The “Haciendo un Mundo Mejor” (Making a Better World) communal bank is made up of tenacious, agreeable and charismatic women who, during meetings, make us all feel as if we were one big family. They are all residents of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay province. It is situated in the southern part of the Ecuadorean Andes. It is the third most important city of Ecuador and it is characterized for maintaining the tranquility and beauty of an old city. Its historical city center was declared Patrimony of Humanity by Unesco in 1999. Yohana V. lives in greater Cuenca in the Don Bosco sector with her sister; they share household expenses. She is originally from Manabí province but moved to this lovely city five years ago to study and work. She is single, 23 years old, and works as an independent Herbalife (natural products) distributor. She has had this job for a year and a half. Her work day starts at 9am and ends at 5:30pm. She tells us that she does well in her work and feels proud because of that. After work, she goes to classes at Catholic University of Cuenca; she’s in her second year, majoring in Journalism. This is her first loan cycle with her communal bank and she is very optimistic about the help she’s gotten. She will use the funds to buy vitamins, nutritional supplements, proteins and other Herbalife products to have varied stock available for her customers. Her greatest dream is to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vitamins, nutritional supplements, Herbalife protein.

loans.name: El Tamarindo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama El tamarindo se llama asi por que las integrantes del grupo se reunen semanalmente bajo un arbol frondoso de tamarindo para que realicen sus pagos.  Esta integrada por 10 personas todas son mujeres y son Rosa , Martha, Maria Magdalena, Araceli, Sacaria, Juana, Dulce Maria, Oralis, Noelia y Lilia todas viven en el municipio de florencio villarreal en el estado de guerrero. Tienen sus pequeños negocios, como Rosa y Martha venden ropa, Maria Magdalena y Margarita tamales, Araceli, Sacaria y Juana compra y venta de pescado, Dulce Maria carniceria, Oralis zapateria, Noelia comida y Lilia perfumes. Todas ellas comenta que se ayudan mucho con sus ventas.

La señora Areceli M. L. tiene 25 años de edad es casada, estudio primaria no la termino pero sabe leer y escribir es madre de 3 hijos el mayor tiene 11 años ya va a terminar la primaria, la otra tiene 10 y 2 años , ella vende pescados en el mercado ya que vive lejos del centro es por eso que renta un local .

Ella comenta que su negocio le da buenos resultados pero es muy pequeño el local es por eso que quiere  prestamo para ampliarlo y adecuarlo a sus necesidades de venta para los clientes y posteriormente remodelar su equipo de trabajo y asi tener mas espacio y mas clientes .
texts.en:
This group is called "El Tamarindo" because the group members meet weekly under a leafy tamarind tree to make their payments. There are 10 members, all of whom are women. They are Rosa, Martha, Maria Magdalena, Araceli, Sacaria, Juana, Dulce Maria, Oralis, Noelia, and Lilia. They all live in the town of Florencio Villarreal in the state of Guerrero. They run their own small businesses. Rosa and Martha sell clothes; Maria Magdalena and Margarita sell tamales; Araceli, Sacaria and Juana buy and sell fish; Dulce Maria runs a butchers shop; Oralis runs a shoe shop; Noelia sells food; and Lilia sells perfume. All of them say that they help a lot with their sales.

Areceli is 25 years old and is married. She did not finish primary school, but she can read and write. She is the mother of 3 children, the oldest is 11 and has finished primary school, and the others are 10 and 2 years old. She sells fish in the market. As she lives far from the town center she rents business premises.

She says that her business gives her good results, but her premises are very small and she wants this loan in order to extend them and adapt them to her needs for selling to her customers and later to remodel her business equipment so she can have more space and more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To extend her business premises

loans.name: Las Praderas Group

texts.es:
Esta unidad de desarrollo se llama las Praderas por que cerca de ahí hay mucho árboles , ya que esta en un poblado del estado de guerrero un poco retirado , para llegar a el es una hora de la cabecera municipal , los integrantes del grupo son 10 personas todas de la misma localidad, son  Reyna , Angelita, Soila, Rosalina, Zarina, Maira, Adelfa, Lucia, Yolanda, Bernabe, Alejandra y Elvia.

Reyna y Angelita venden refrescos, Soila, ropa; Rosalina, productos de bimbo; Zarina  y Maira, frutas y verduras; Adelfa y Lucia, comida; Yolanda elabora comales, Bernabé, carnicería; Alejandra  panaderia y Elvia abarrotes.

La señora Maira Z. G. es la representante del grupo tiene 21 años y vive en union libre , sabe leer y escribir estudio secundaria aunque no la termino. Tiene 3 niñas de 6,4 y 2 años tiene su negocio de frutas y verduras en su casa ya que vive en el centro. Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio se ayuda para surtirse de cosas, pero ella quisiera ayudarse de un préstamo para mantener a sus hijas es por ello que necesita necesita el prestamo para comprar otras cosas como queso seco y productos ya que ha visto que eso se vende mucho y le dara buenos ganancias y asi le alcanzara para vestir y mantener mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
This development unit is called Las Praderas (The Meadows) because there are many trees nearby. It is a settlement in the state of Guerrero that is a bit remote; it is an hour from the municipal center. The members of the group are 10 persons from the same location. They are: Reyna , Angelita, Soila, Rosalina, Zarina, Maira, Adelfa, Lucia, Yolanda, Bernabe, Alejandra and Elvia. Reyna and Angelita sell beverages. Soila sells clothes. Rosalina sells Bimbo (bakery) products. Zarina and Maira sell fruits and vegetables. Adelfa and Lucia sell food. Yolanda makes comales (flat earthen ware pan for cooking tortillas). Bernabé is a butcher, Alejandra is a baker and Elvia is a grocer. Maira Z. G., 21, is the group representative. She is in a common-law union and knows how to read and write. She went to junior high school but did not complete it. She has three daughters, who are 6, 4, and 2 years of age. She has a fruit and vegetable stand in her home since she lives downtown. She uses her profits to supply herself with things but she wants to have funding to support her daughters. She needs funds to buy certain other items like: dry cheese and products because she has noticed that these items sell well and that would provide her with good profits so that she will have enough to better dress and support her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dry cheese, bread, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Flor De Mayo 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta integrado por 12 personas las cuales son : Jovita, Clarita, Alberta , Inocencia , Eloisa, Oralia, Julia, Faustina, Eliz, Elizabeth , Soledad y Julieta todas ellas viven en un poblado alejado D. la cabecera municipal en el estado D. guerrero, cada una D. ellas tienen sus pequeños negocios , Jacoba se dedica a la compra y venta D. pescado y verduras, Clarita y Alberta venden pescado, Inocencia venD. frutas, Eloisa y Julia son costureras, Oralia venD. dulces , Faustina, polL.; Eliz venD. en una cooperativa, Elizabeth venD. pan , Soledad, productos nutricionales y Julieta venD. accesorios para dama.

La señora Jacoba es casada tiene 5 hijos D. 18,17,14,11,y 10 años. Sabe leer y escribir aunque no termino la escuela, lo que  ella quiere es comprar diferentes frutas y verduras asi como ditistos pescados. Ya que no se surte mucho por sus gastos para  sus hijos  y lo poco que venD. lo termina  rapido, y ella quiere  comprar variedad para que venda mucho y tenga mas ganancia.

Es por eso que necesita el prestamo para invertirlo  en comprar  diferentes frutas y verduras asi como distintos pescados ya que asi tendrias mas ganancias y asi se  ayudaria mejor con L. gastos D. sus hijos.

Hasta ahorita esta tranquila con el grupo ya que todas se conocen bien , y esta muy contenta con el credito que se le otorgara ya que a trabajado con otras compañias y esta viendo la  gran diferencia del porcentaje que cobran.
texts.en:
This Group is maD. up of 12 persons who are: Jovita, Clarita, Alberta , Inocencia , Eloisa, Oralia, Julia, Faustina, Eliz, Elizabeth , Soledad and Julieta. They all live in a settlement that is far from the municipal center in the state of Guerrero. Each has a small business: Jacoba is a fish and vegetable merchant. Clarita and Alberta sell fish. Inocencia sells fruit, Eloisa and Julia are seamstresses. Oralia sells candy and Faustina sells chickens. Eliz sells in a co-op and Elizabeth sells bread. Soledad sells nutritional products and Julieta sells women’s accessories. Jacoba is married and has 5 children, who are 18, 17, 14, 11 and 10 years of age. She can read and write even though she did not finish school. She wants to buy a variety of different fruits, vegetables and fish. Because of her children’s expenses, she can’t afford to stock large quantities so, what little she sells, goes quickly. She wants to buy a variety of product so that she can sell more and earn more profits. This is why she needs the loan: to invest in the purchase of various fruits, vegetables and fish. This way she will have more profits and that will help her with her children’s expenses. To date, she is at peace with the group since they all know each other very well. She is happy with the loan that she will have granted because she has worked with other companies and she is seeing the big difference in interest percentage that they charge.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fish.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos ya son independientes, vive junto a su hija menor en casa de su madre, ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace 20 años. Cría aves de corral y cerdos en la parte posterior de su vivienda, los engorda para luego comercializarlos con los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Aurelia nos comenta que también cría vacas con el mismo fin pero que las cría en un terreno que posee en las afueras del distrito. Esta actividad se ha convertido en el principal ingreso económico con el cual sostiene los gastos familiares y cuida de su madre, que es de edad avanzada.

Aurelia desea mejorar la alimentación de los animales que cría con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y que ha luchado por salir adelante a pesar de su condición de madre soltera, sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una persona de confianza. Su sueño es hacer mejoras en la vivienda donde vive ya que es de construcción antigua.
texts.en:
Aurelia is 49 years old. She’s a single mother of three children, two of whom are independent. She lives with her youngest daughter in her mother’s house, which is in Zaña district, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has raised animals for 20 years. She raises barnyard fowl and pigs in her back yard. She fattens them up and then sells to merchants that visit the area. Aurelia tells us that she also raises cows with the same goal in mind but she raises them on property that she has on the outskirts of the district. This activity has become her main source of income with which she supports her family and cares for her mother, who is getting on in years. Aurelia would like to improve the nutrition of her animals so that they will produce higher profits at sale time. With this in mind, she finds herself in need of calling upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 700 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed. She is a hard-working woman who has struggled to get ahead despite being a single mother. Her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high regard and consider her to be a trustworthy person. Her dream is to make some home improvements on her dwelling because it is of very old construction.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Cristino Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Cristino Mejía es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se graduó en la carrera de Administración de Empresas, ha brindado 21 años de servicio al Ministerio de Educación y actualmente se desempeña como Director del Instituto de secundaria Jonathán Gonzales. Ha recibido dos créditos de Ceprodel para mejorar su vivienda, este último crédito lo solicitó para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, piedra y mano de obra con el objetivo de brindar un mejor nivel de vida y status social a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Cristino Mejía is from El Sauce. He graduated with a degree in Business Administration. He has worked for the Ministry of Education for 21 years. Currently, he is principal of Jonathán Gonzales secondary school. He has received two previous loans from Ceprodel that he used to make some home improvements. This most recent loan will be used to buy bricks, cement and stone and to pay for labor costs. The goal is to provide a better standard of living and social status for his three children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. José Francisco es originario de la comarca San Ramón del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como conserje en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene dos años de laborar para dicha Institución. Este señor ha recibido dos créditos de Ceprodel los cuales le han servido de mucho para asumir gastos personales de su familia, este último crédito lo solicitó para invertirlo en compra de medicinas para la recuperación de su esposa.
texts.en:
Mr. José Francisco comes from the region of San Ramón, municipality of El Sauce. He has worked at El Sauce's City Hall as a building caretaker for two years. José has received two loans from Kiva partner CEPRODEL, which he has used for personal and family expenses; this loan he will use to buy medicine for his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying medicine

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es:
Mariza tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Reque, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a brindar servicio de confección de prendas de vestir en un pequeño taller instalado en su domicilio. Empezó a desempeñarse en esta actividad gracias a las enseñanzas de un familiar y poco a poco se ha hecho conocida en el medio gracias a la responsabilidad y calidad con la que elabora sus trabajos.

Su taller ha crecido poco a poco y ahora ya cuenta con una máquina de coser semi – industrial. Mariza desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de materiales (telas e hilos) con los cuales pueda empezar a confeccionar uniformes escolares ya que las clases a nivel nacional ya están por empezar, por ello está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Mariza es una mujer responsable y bastante entregada a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y llegar a tener un taller más grande con el cual pueda dar trabajo a otras mujeres que gusten de la  costura.
texts.en:
Mariza is 46 years old, single and lives with her parents in the district of Reque, twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been devoted for the last ten years to the making of clothing at a small workshop at her house. She started this activity with the help and teachings of a family member, and then little by little has gotten a good reputation thanks to the quality of her work.

Her workshop has gradually grown and now she has a semi - industrial sewing machine. Mariza wants to expand her business and purchase materials such as fabric and yarn, to make school’s uniforms since the school year is about to start. This is why she is asking for a loan for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for $200 that she plans to use in achieving her goal.

Mariza is a responsible and very devoted woman. Her greatest desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur and potentially to have a larger workshop where she can create jobs for other women who like sewing.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Menime

texts.en:
Menime K. is 19 and married with 1 child (1 year-old).  She is starting a business venture, selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Menime needs a loan of WST $1000 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Menime joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Menime's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Menime K. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.7 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es:
Sandra L. es socia del banco comunal Haciendo un mejor futuro está integrado por mujeres luchadoras, con una simpatía y carisma que nos hacen sentir como en familia durante las reuniones del banco, todas las socias viven  en la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana; es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

 Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad Santa Anita en la parroquia Turi  con su hijo de 4 años y  su esposo que trabaja en la rama de la construcción y gracias a todo el esfuerzo en su unión conyugal se siente argullosa de tener su casa propia.

Ella vende productos nutricionales Herbalife, su horario de trabajo es de 9 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m., y se encuentra realizando esta actividad hace 2 años y le va bien ya que cuenta con su propia clientela, visita a sus clientes recorriendo toda su comunidad para ganar un poco mas de mercado es una tare muy dura y sacrificada ya que todo el día pasa fuera de casa y casi no comparte con su pequeño hijo.

Es socia activa del banco comunal hace  un año y con la ayuda en la fundación  ha ido incrementado su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo va a comprar vitaminas, y suplementos proteicos Herbalife para seguir creciendo con su negocio, su meta es terminar su casa ya que aún le falta algunos terminados.
texts.en:
Sandra L. is a member of the Haciendo un Mejor Futuro (Building a Better Future) communal bank, which is made up of tenacious women who, because of their good humor and charisma, make us all feel like one big family during bank meetings. All of the members live in the city of Cuenca, capital of Azuay province. It is located in the southern part of the Ecuadorean Andes. It is Ecuador’s third most important city and it is characterized by maintaining the tranquility and beauty of an old city. Its historic city center was declared a Patrimony of Humanity by Unesco in 1999. Sandra lives in Santa Anita, Turi parish with her 4-year-old son and her husband, who works in construction. Thanks to the joint effort of herself and her husband she is proud to have her own home. She sells Herbalife products. Her working schedule is from 9am to 7pm. She has been in this line of work for 2 years and she does well because she has steady customers. She visits them throughout the community to gain a bigger market share; this is hard and demanding work in that she spends all day away from home and hardly spends any time with her little boy. She has been an active member of the communal bank for a year. With help from the Foundation she has been expanding her business. She will use the new loan to buy vitamins and Herbalife protein supplements so that her business will continue to grow. Her goal is to finish her house since it still lacks some finishing touches.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vitamins and protein supplements.

loans.name: German Francisco

texts.es: German tiene 63 años de edad, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio que es su único medio de trabajo. El inicio esta actividad por medio un amigo que le brindo cierta orientación con este trabajo, además Germán tenía el la suficiente experiencia para realizar este tipo de trabajo, pues es una persona muy sociable y le ha gustado mantener a sus clientes. Su deseo es adquirir otra unidad de taxi, para mejorar sus ingresos. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de llantas, focos, cambio de aceite entre otros arreglos.
texts.en:
German is 63 years old and has been dedicated to provide transportation services for more than 9 years. It is his only source of income.

He started in this activity with the help of a friend that gave him some guidance with this work. German also had enough experience to perform the job since he is a very social person and has liked to keep his customers.

His desire is to get another taxi to improve his income. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of tires, lights, oil change among some other maintenance work.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es: José Gabriel tiene 58 años, es un hombre trabajador que ama su trabajo. El se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de soldadura hace mas de 31 años que se dedica a esta actividad, el inicia este negocio por cuenta propia ya que para en ese tiempo tenía que mantener a sus 4 hijos, que actualmente trabajan de manera independiente, pues le fue de gran ayuda ya que él les proporciono estudio y todas las cosas necesarias. El solicita actualmente este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima para su taller. Su deseo es seguir acondicionando su vivienda que es lugar de su trabajo.
texts.en:
José is 58 years old, and he's a hardworking man who loves his work. He has been offering welding services for more than 31 years. He started this business for himself because, at that time, he had 4 children to provide for. Today they all work independently, but he was of great help to them as he provided all the things they needed. He is requesting this current loan for business capital that will be used to buy raw materials for his workshop. His wish is to continue improving his home, which is also his work place.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Hugo Daniel

texts.es:
Hugo es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo de 12 años de edad en la ciudad de Reque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace 10 años a brindar servicio de tallado en piedra y a la elaboración de lápidas. Este trabajo consiste en tallar piedras para hacer decoraciones en fachadas e interiores de viviendas, por otro lado, aplica sus habilidades para elaborar lápidas fúnebres. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingreso con la que sustenta los gastos familiares por lo que da lo mejor de sí para salir adelante.

Sus habilidades le han permitido hacerse más conocido en la zona, y sus servicios encuentran cada vez mas demanda, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de materiales (piedras, cinceles y combas) con los cuales pueda seguir trabajando.

Hugo es una persona bastante responsable y muy comprometida con su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es poder hacer modelos en su casa ya que está construida de material rustico.
texts.en:
Hugo, 32, lives with his wife and 12-year-old son in Reque, which is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 10 years he has worked as a stone engraver and tombstone maker. The work consists in engraving stones to be used as decorations on facades or interiors of homes. On the other hand, he also applies his skills to making tombstones. This business is his family’s sole source of income; he gives his best to it, therefore, in order to succeed. His skills have made it possible for him to become more well-known in the area and his services are more in demand every day. For this reason, he has had to call upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 1000 new sol loan. He plans to use the funds to buy supplies and materials (stone, chisels, stone engraving tools) with which to continue working. Hugo is quite a responsible person who is dedicated to his work. His greatest wish is to remodel his house because it is built with just rudimentary materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone working tools.

loans.name: Yanina Marieli

texts.es:
Yanina tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus dos menores hijos en casa de su madre, donde también viven sus hermanos, algunos de ellos con su propia familia. Esta vivienda se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el segundo distrito más poblado de la región Lambayeque, y el primero más pobre.

Desde hace más de 02 años se dedica a la venta de mazamorra y arroz con leche (dulces tipicos del país) recorriendo las calles del distrito José Leonardo Ortiz. La venta se realiza en las tardes,y además cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana, su madre (que vende en un parque del distrito  ubicándose allí con su mesita y una vitrina), y una amiga. 

Los postres son preparados y colocados en vasitos, diariamente preparan 450 vasitos, los cuales los venden a S/. 0.50 céntimos. Debido a que ya son conocidas en la zona, casi siempre venden lo que preparan diariamente. Yanina desea ampliar su negocio, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para los postres, compra de vasitos y cucharas plásticas, y para invertir en la venta de bebidas gaseosas y bodoques, para lo cual necesita reparar su refrigeradora.

Yanina es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. En la fotografía aparece preparando sus vasitos de postre, antes de salir a venderlos.
texts.en:
Yanina, 36, is a single mother. She lives with her two minor children in her mother’s house where her siblings, some with families of their own, also live. The home is located in the José Leonardo Ortiz neighborhood, which is the second-most populated in Lambayeque region, but also the poorest. For over 2 years she has sold “mazamorra” and “arroz con leche” (typical desserts of the country) along the various streets of José Leonardo Ortiz neighborhood. She makes her sales in the afternoons. She can count on help selling from her sister, her mother (who sets up her little table and display case in a local park), and a friend. The desserts are prepared and served in little glasses. They make 450 portions daily and sell them for 50 cents each. Because they are well-known in the area, they almost always sell everything they prepare daily. Yanina wants to enlarge her business so is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol loan. The funds will be used to buy ingredients for the desserts, to buy the little serving glasses and plastic spoons, and to invest in the sale of soft-drinks and bodoques (frozen treats served in plastic bags). To do this, she needs to repair her refrigerator. Yanina is a hard-working, responsible woman. In the photo she is shown preparing the glasses of dessert prior to going out to sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her desserts.

loans.name: Vicente Narcizo

texts.es:
El señor Vicente Narcizo A. tiene ya más de diez años dedicándose a la venta y reparación llantas de autos y de partes usadas.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta variedad de mercancía y desea mejorar más el local, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del su negocio y con esta nueva inversión.
texts.en:
Mr. Vicente Narcizo A. has been working for the last ten years repairing and selling car tires and used parts. His business needs more merchandise variety and he wishes to improve the shop, but he doesn’t have enough capital to use. That is why he is asking for a loan. He plans to pay back the loan with the profits that he receives from his business and from the new money that he will put in.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and to improve his shop

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Alberto H. tiene ya mas de cuatro años con su negocio de venta de ropa el con el cual le ayudado a salir a delante.
A su negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de ropa y de verano ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo que tenga ese tipo de mercancía ya a la venta.
Pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así comprar la mercancía y satisfacer a sus clientes. 
Don Jorge Alberto también es empleado de una compañía de mensajeria como chofer repartidor, con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Elia Lara esposa del señor Jorge Alberto, quien le ayuda ha tender el negocio cuando el se encuentra en el trabajo.
texts.en:
Alberto H. has sold clothing for over 4 years now; this has helped him to get ahead in life. His business is needing inventory, espceially a variety of clothing and Summer clothes, because his customers are requesting this type of merchandise. For the moment, however, he lacks the necessary funds to make this investment. For this reason, he is asking for a loan to buy merchandise so that he can satisfy his customers. Jorge Alberto is also employed as a deliveryman for a currier service; he plans to use part of his earnings to repay the loan. The person in the photo is Elia Lara, Jorge Alberto's wife, who helps him tend to the business when he's at work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
A la vivienda del joven Francisco A. le está haciendo falta los acabados del interior, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora.
Es por eso que esta solicitando el préstamo y así mejorar la casa donde vive con su mama que es una persona mayor de edad y esta bajo su responsabilidad.
Planea pagar el préstamo con los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo como jefe de meseros de un restaurante.
texts.en:
Francisco A.'s house is still missing its interior finishing touches but he doesn't have funds at present to buy materials and pay labor costs to the person who would do these improvements. For this reason, he is asking for a loan so that he can improve his home where he lives with his mother, who is a senior citizen under his care. He plans to repay the loan with part of his earnings as a head waiter in a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For interior finishing touches.

loans.name: Faapale

texts.en:
Faapale T. is 55 and married with 10 children (ages 19 - 35).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Faapale has many years of experience in this business.  Faapale needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Faapale joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faapale's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faapale T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. loans.name: Santana

texts.es: El señor Santana L. B. tiene 3 años de estar laborando Con CEPRODEL-El sauce, habita en la comarca san Nicolás municipio Achuapa, se dedica a la actividad de repasto de novillo el crédito solicitado  es para la compro de 3 ternero de desarrollo, tiene su propia finca la inversión la realiza en su propiedad para así sacarle aprovecho y obtener un mayor ingreso y abastecer la necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Santana L. B. has been a member of CEPRODEL - El Sauce for three years. He lives in the San Nicolás region, municipality of Achuapa. He develops calves and the loan he is requesting will be used for buying three calves for developing into grown animals. He owns his farm and what he earns he invests in his property in order to increase his income and support his family's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying calves

loans.name: Antonia Del Rosario

texts.es: La clienta Antonia Del Rosario E. Gonzales  tiene 3 años de estar laborando Con CEPRODEL-El sauce, este es el segundo crédito otorgado con vuestra oficina, habita en la comarca san Nicolás municipio Achuapa, se dedica a la actividad de compra de novillo para bueyes  el crédito solicitado  es para la compro de 2 novillo de desarrollo el cual el cliente lo ase bueyes y lo vende a un mejor precio, tiene su propia finca la inversión la realiza en su propiedad para así sacarle aprovecho y obtener un mayor ingreso y abastecer la necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonia Del Rosario E. G.has been a member of the CEPRODEL - El Sauce bank for three years and this is the second loan she gets through Kiva. Antonia lives in the region of San Nicolás, in the municipality of Achuapa. She buys calves, then sells them once they are grown. She will use this loan to buy two calves, which she will grow and then sell at a better price. Antonia owns her own farm; the profit her business makes, she invests in the farm, increasing her income and fulfilling the needs of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying calves

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Labo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, she is married, and has one adult child.

Teresita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Teresita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma E., 65, is a hard working single mom who is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs by managing her own variety store for nine years 

Norma has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than eight years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 26 times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues and has used the money she borrowed as added capital for her business.   Her business enables her to earn a profit of 8,500 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 34,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying different food products for her store.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can finance her children's  education. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Many Cambodia rural people earn a living by working at the garment factories.  One of those citizens, Mrs. Kan M. is a garment worker and is able to earn a salary of $90 a month. She uses this income to support all her family expenses such as meals, clothing, medical bills, and her children's school fees. Additionally, her husband farms a several types of crops. He also buys animals to fatten and then resells them. Kan M. is bringing up three children while another two of her children are married and live away from home. Kan M. is requesting a loan for her husband to use to plant crops and buy more animals.

loans.use: To plant crops and buy more animals.

loans.name: Tiang

texts.en:
In order to earn a daily revenue, Mrs. Tiang C., age 60, sells both used and new cloth at the local busy market. With this business, she is able to feed her family. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a local rice farmer. This couple has been married for several years and has been blessed with  eleven children. Three of them are married and the remaining eight are single. Two of her daughters are employed at the garment factory. 

Tiang C. has a single daughter who is jobless and she wants to have a suitable occupation but doesn’t have capital to start a business. Because of this, Tiang C. is requesting a loan in order to buy a variety of groceries as inventory so that her daughter can begin selling in the village. (Tiang C. was not available at that time so her daughter is pictured in her place.)

loans.use: To buy a variety of groceries for inventory.

texts.en:
Federico B. is from the village of Gappal, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is fifty-one years old. Federico is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Federico is married and has five grown children. To make a living, Federico owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Federico has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP every four months through his business. 

In 2006, Federico joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Federico is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be Federico's ninth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou D., 32, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. Married to Jolan Bandola, a pest exterminator, they are blessed with one child. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for four years.

Marilou has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow five times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed as added capital for her business. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 7,500 per month.

Now, with your help, Marilou would like to obtain a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying assorted products for her store.

Marilou dreams that her business will improve so that she can save to buy their own house someday.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy assorted products for her store

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom M. is aged 40. She resides in Dongkor District, about 10 km from Phnom Penh city. Her husband is shown in the photo.

Mom M. has a job sewing clothing in a garment factory and earns a specific salary. This income is used towards caring for her two young kids while her third child is married and lives independently.

The other source of family income comes from her husband’s work selling charcoal and he is also a construction worker. Beside their current work, they have also always operated a rice cultivating business.

Mom M. is taking out her loan to accumulate a larger amount of charcoal for her husband to sell and will use the rest to buy a water pump to irrigate her crop and pump water for her family's use.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger amount of charcoal for her husband's business and to buy a water pump

loans.name: Editha

She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her food vending canteen for nine years.

Editha has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than eight years now. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow several times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy food ingredients for her canteen.
 
Now, with your help, Editha would like to obtain a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying ingredients for the viands she sells in her canteen.

Editha dreams that her business will grow so that she and her husband can save enough money to buy their own house and lot.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. Both of them have managed their bakery for twelve years.

Minda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than four years now. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow eight times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy key ingredients for making bread. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 9,000 per month.

Now, with your help, Minda would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying flour and other key ingredients for making bread.

Minda dreams that their business will grow so that they can open another bakery store in their province.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

texts.en:
Eden B., 48, is a single, hardworking mother of five children.  She has been managing her own variety store for 10 years.

Eden has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for several months now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow three times from the CCT Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues. She used the money she borrowed to buy added stocks for her store. She earns a profit of PHP 10,200 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to borrow PHP 8,000. She will use this money to her expanding business by buying assorted beverages.

She dreams that her business will grow and provide her family with a better standard of living. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.name: Leoniva

texts.en:
Leoniva A.,  52, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Prospero A., an Overseas Filipino Worker. They are blessed with three children. She helps her husband earn money so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for six years.

Leoniva has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than seven years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow 18 times from the CCT Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues. She uses the money she borrows to buy stock for her store. She earns a profit of PHP 9,620 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to borrow PHP 15,000. She will use this money to buy soft drinks and other food products for her store.

She dreams that her business will continue to develop so that she can help her children be stable in their lives.

Jeanette T., 38, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Aden T., a company painter, they are blessed with three children. Jeanette has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than eight years. Catalina C., 60, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs.
