He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase additional inventory in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan is 35 years old and lives with his wife and their two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a rented 'ger', the Mongolian nomadic tent. His older daughter goes to a local secondary school. They have been living in their current home for three years.

In 2007, Batsaihan started his livestock trading business with his wife. Since they started their business, their quality of life has been improving. Batsaihan purchases young livestock at cheap prices, and when they are grown up he sells them for a profit. He began with a working capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~140  USD), but with a lot of hard work he was able to grow his working capital to the level of 500,000 tugrugs (~ 351 USD). He has been planning to expand his business in the future. 

Batsaihan is a very hard-working person and has great communication skills. He says, “I would like to  provide my children with a good education and good morals. ” He is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~ 422 USD) loan to purchase livestock and resell the animals for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Trần's Group

texts.en:
L. Trần Thị is a 41 year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc N..  L. is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 07 (Nhóm 07).

L. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, L. sells confectionary products in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

L.  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. is requesting her first loan from SEDA.  She is seeking a loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Trương Thị N. is a 52 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her clothing business.


2.  Vũ Thị Bình, 54, is seeking a 5.152.000 VND loan for her food-stall business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị V., 36, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan for her food-stall business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị Tuyết, 33, would use her 5.152.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


5.  Cao Thị Hiền, 30, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.


6.  Đỗ Thị Lộc, 39, would like a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L.  Trần Thị (20203020041) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc N..  L.  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 07 (Nhóm 07).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L.  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L.  kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  L.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L.  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trương Thị N. (20203020042) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


2.  Vũ Thị Bình (20203020043) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  Nguyễn Thị V.  (20203020044) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  Nguyễn Thị Tuyết (20203020045) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


5.  Cao Thị Hiền (20203020046) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


6.  Đỗ Thị Lộc (20203020047) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

She has been managing three different types of businesses: her own tailoring shop, a buy-and-sell business and a charcoal repacking business.

Evelyn has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her dues consistently. Because of her good repayment history with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she has used the money she has borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

Now, with your help, Evelyn would like to obtain a PHP 20,000 loan. This money will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business, and she will use it to incorporate more into her inventories and purchase the raw materials and supplies that she needs to continue her operations. Evelyn dreams that her business will continue to grow for her children’s future. She wants them to have a good and comfortable life.


* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase supplies that she needs to continue her operations

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Mrs. Angelie U., is 30, married, and lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is married to Renante.  They are blessed with 4 children, several of whom are pictured with Angelie.  Three of their children are infants, and the oldest is school-aged. 

Renante dives for shells, known locally as “amahong" and "burnay,” while Angelie sells the shells.  They have shared this livelihood for several years, and earn an average net income of about P5,000.00 a month.

Angelie joined the cooperative in the year 2008. Given her good credit record and capacity to pay, she has been approved for a loan of P14,000.00 to install electricity in her family's home, with the remainder to be used to support their business. The future income that results from this loan will be used for the family's daily basic needs, loan repayments and to save for their children’s future needs, especially in their education.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To install electricity and to support the family business.

loans.name: Mary Rose's Group

texts.en: Mary Rose P.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She is 31 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the village of Bitag Grande, Baggao, Cagayan. Mary Rose has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2005, Mary Rose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Mary Rose is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support extended members of her family. Mary Rose is the leader of a 12 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia C., 51, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Salvador C., a foreman/contractor, and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Olivia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.

Now, with your help, Olivia would like to apply for a 12,000 Philippine peso loan. This money will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business to buy groceries needed to replenish stock in her product inventory.

Olivia dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She wants them to be comfortably well off.

loans.use: To buy groceries to replenish stock

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en: L. Nguyễn Thị's (20211040023) main source of income comes from raising chickens for sale. She is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has one school-age child. L. has been in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous L. of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She is now requesting a new L. of 2,464,000 VND which will again be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her first L. from SEDA. L. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. L. is the leader of a six member group accessing a L. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual L., they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Trà 1 - Nhóm 07 (Nhóm 07). About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Ngô Thị P. (20211040027) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock. 2. Nguyễn Thị Hạt (20211040025) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,808,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock. 3. Nguyễn Thị T. (20211040028) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock. 4. Nguyễn Thị Hòa (20211040044) is a 24-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,360,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock. 5. Nguyễn Thị Hằng (20211040024) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. L. Nguyễn Thị (20211040023) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Trà 1 - Nhóm 07 (Nhóm 07). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 2.464.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Ngô Thị P. (20211040027) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn Thị Hạt (20211040025) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.808.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Nguyễn Thị T. (20211040028) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Nguyễn Thị Hòa (20211040044) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. Nguyễn Thị Hằng (20211040024) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mamatova Sveta`s Group

texts.ru:
Маматова Света, ей 22 года. Она замужем и воспитывает двоих сыновей. Клиент проживает в селе Араван, вместе с супругом и его родителями. Супруг работает таксистом в родном селе. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 100 долларов. С раннего возраста  вместе с родителями Света занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно растениеводством. В данное время она готовится к весеннему посеву. В этом году они планируют посеять картофель,  и кредит будет использован для закупа семян и удобрений. 

Тазагул, 24, замужем и проживает вместе с родителями супруга. Ее муж в данное время работает в Казахстане в сфере торговли. Тазагул по специальности швея. Она шьет постельное белье, женские халаты, сарафаны и пр. Кредит будет использован для закупа ХБ ткани для шитья постельного белья. 

Мусаева Сапилахан проживает вместе с мужем и тремя детьми. Ее супруг заниается реализацией пиломатериалов в с. Араван, сама же работает учителем кыргызского языка в одной из селських сел. Кроме этого у них в собственности есть торговая точка по реализации детской одежды на центральном рынке. В торговле ей помогает родная сестра. Кредит будет использован для увеличения товаро обората детской одежды. 

Эрнисбек является 4 участником этой группы солидарности. Ему 22 года. Эрнисбек является студентом ВУЗа, изучает китайский язык. Он проживает вместе с родителями. Семья клиента имеет собственный земельный надел с 1994. В начале они в основном выращивали табак, однако в связи с падением рентабельности продукции, перешли на картофель. Сейчас они собираются приобрести 500 кг семян картофеля на этот кредит. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Sveta M. is 22 years old. She is married and is raising two sons. She lives in the village of Aravan together with her husband and parents-in-law. Her husband works as a taxi driver in this village. The monthly income is around $100. Since she was young Sveta together with her parents has been in agriculture mainly growing plants. At this time she is getting ready for the spring sowing. This year she plans to sow potatoes and will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. Tazargul is 24, she is married and lives with husband and parents-in-law. Her husband at this time works in the retail field in Kazakhstan. Tazargul is a seamstress. She sews bedding sheets, women's robes, dresses and etc. She will use the loan to buy the fabric to make the bedding. Sapilahan M. lives together with her husband and children. Her husband sells materials in the village of Aravan, and she works as a teacher of the Kyrgyz language at one of the local schools. Besides that they also have own stall where they sell children's clothing on the central market. Her sister helps her with the sales. She will use the loan to increase sales of children's clothing. Ernisbek is the fourth member of this solidarity group. He is 22 years old. Ernisbek is a university student, he studies Chinese. He lives with his parents. His family has their own land since 1994. In the beginning they were growing mainly tobacco, but because of the decrease in the demand in the product they have switched to potatoes. At this time they plan to buy 500 kg of potato seeds on this loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. S., 41, is married to Yout, age 46, and they are currently construction laborers in a building place located in the middle of Phnom Penh capital. Usually they both are able to generate around $7 each day to cover their family’s daily living expense. S. now has five children; one is married and the others are single. Two of her children are employed. Her daughter is a garment worker and son works in construction. (S. was not available at that time so her husband is shown instead in the picture above.) S. has a single son who needs a life partner in his wife and the condition requires him to get married but he doesn’t have money. So, S. requested a loan to allow her son to arrange a wedding party.

loans.use: To arrange a wedding party for her son.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị (20211040003) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Trà 1 - Nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).


L. is married and has two infant-aged children.  To making a living, L. owns & operates a specialized retail store selling metal & metal-related products in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,256,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND, which will be used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Thủy (20211040005) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Trà 1 - Nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm kim loại & có L. quan đến kim loại trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.256.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business

loans.name: Buuveibaatar

texts.en: Buuveibaatar is 40 years old and lives with his wife and their two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter goes to a university. In 2003, he started the intestine processing business with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~ 351 USD). After seven years of hard work, his working capital has grown to 8,000,000 tugrugs (~ 5,629 USD). Because of his business success Buuveibaatar has been able to pay for his children's tuition fees and provide money to cover family expenses. He is a very hardworking person and has a great business mind. Buuveibaatar is requesting a 3,800,000 tugrug loan to purchase raw intestines from suppliers in his own province, for processing at his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw intestines

loans.name: Tashanova Umsun's Group

texts.ru:
Это история пришла к вам из маленького села расположенного на границе двух стран: Кыргызстан и Узбекистан. В наши сложные времена несколько человек решили объединить свои усилия для поддержки друг друга, с целью улучшения своей жизни и создания новых возможностей. Они получают кредит в МБФ уже в третий раз, показали себя отличными заемщиками и хорошими людьми. 

Начнем презентацию членов группы, как обычно с лидера, человека собравшего всех вместе. 

Умсун 50 лет, замужем и воспитывает 2 детей: сына и дочьку. Сын учится в выпускном классе средней школы, а дочь уже студентка первого курса факультета иностранных языков. Ее супруг работает ветеринарным врачом в сельской управе. Сама же преподает кыргызский язык в местной школе. Кроме этого семья клиента занимается разведением скота, посевом сельхоз угодий, а также розничной реализацией товаров народного потребления с домашнего магазина. Кредит будет использован для закупа одного теленка-бычка для последужющего выращивания. 

Майрамкан 47 лет, мать двоих детей. У них достаточно большой семейный бизнес, который включает животноводство и птицеводство, а также производство молока и молочных продуктов. Этим бизнесом они начали заниматься с 1990 года. В данное время у них есть 3 дойных коровы, 1 лошадь, 50 кур, 15 овец. На этот кредит они планируют купить сено и корма для живности. 

Мурзаева Фариде 25 лет. Она проживает с матерью-пенсионеркой, братом и сестрой. Два старших члена семьи находятся на заработказ в РФ. Ежемесячно отсылают минимум 300 долларов. Они занимаются выращиванием сельхоз культур. В год получают по два урожая. Первым планируют посеить картофель, а на второй посеить кукурузу и подсолнух. Кредит будет использован для оплаты услуг тракториста, а также закуп пару овец для выращивания. 

Лолахон, 43, вдова. В одиночестве воспитывает одного 13 летнего сына. Ее мечта дать ему возможность получить хорощее образование. Она работает бухгалтером в Гулбаарской сельской управе. Кредит будет использован для закупа строительных материалов (цемент, известь). 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
This story comes to you from a small village located on the border of two countries: Kyrgyztan and Uzbekistan. During these difficult times several people have decided to come together for each other's support with one goal to make their lives better and to create new possibilities. They are receiving a loan at MCC MBF for the third time and have shown to be outstanding borrowers and good people. Let's begin the introduction of the group members starting with the leader, as usual, who has brought everyone together. Umsun is 50 years old, she is married and is raising two children - a son and a daughter. Her son is finishing his senior year in the secondary school, and her daughter is already a first year student in college majoring in foreign languages. Her husband works as a veterinarian in the village board. She is a Kyrgyz language teacher in the local school. Besides everything her family has a cattle breeding business, a vegetable sowing business and also a retail business selling household products and other goods from their home store. The loan will be used to buy a calf for growing. Mayramkan is 47 years old, she is a mother of two children. They have a very large family business which includes animal husbandry and bird breeding, as well as production of milk and milk products. They started this business in 1990. At this time they have three milk cows, one horse, 50 chickens and fifteen sheep. They plan to use this loan to buy hay stock and fodder for the livestock. Farida M. is 25 years old. She lives with her senior mother, brother and sister. Two older family members and now working in the Russian Federation. They send at least $300 every month. They are in agriculture and collect the harvest twice a year. For the first one they plan to sow potatoes and for the second one corn and sunflowers. The loan will be used to pay for the tractor services and to buy a couple of sheep for growing. Lolahon is 43, she is a widow. She is raising a thirteen year old son by herself. Her dream is to give him the opportunity to get good education. She works as an accountant in the Gulbaar local board. The loan will be used to buy building materials (e.g. cement, limestone).

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one calf, hay, fodder, building materials

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
Hằng Ngô Thị (20211020017) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hằng is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ngô Nội 1 - Nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).


Hằng is married and has two infants. To making a living, Hằng owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Hằng has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Hằng joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hằng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Hằng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Ước (20211020018) is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20211020015) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20211020014) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


4.  Nghiêm Thị Chín (20211020016) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business providing recycling services.


5.  Nguyễn Bá Tuấn (20211020043) is a 34-year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his business providing recycling services.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hằng Ngô Thị (20211020017) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hằng là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ngô Nội 1 - Nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để B.n.  Hằng thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hằng kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Hằng đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hằng đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.256.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & B.n sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Ước (20211020018) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20211020015) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20211020014) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn B.n thức ăn.


4.  Nghiêm Thị Chín (20211020016) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


5.  Nguyễn Bá Tuấn (20211020043) là 34 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông B.o bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông B.o các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

Hà Nguyễn Thị T. (20201030047) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Nịnh.  Hà is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phố Chờ 1 - nhóm 09 (Nhóm 09).


Hà is married and has three school-aged children.  To making a living, Hà works in someone else's business providing photography services to local community members.  Hà has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2.600.000 VND a month from these activities.


Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hà is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: At the every, Mrs. Ya T. is very busy caring for her grown pigs in the pigpen next to her house. This action is to earn money in order to contribute to her family. She can sell all her pig to buyers every three or four months after she begins breeding. She has been engaged in this sector since she was single. Ya T. was married a lot of years ago to Khoeun, 39, a building worker. They both have seven teenage children who are students and are also temporarily laborers. Ya T. will use her first loan to buy a small plot of land in a good location for farming. She will plant a variety crops on her new land for extra income.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of land

loans.name: Ronielyn

texts.en: Ronielyn S. is from the village of Bogabongan, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ronielyn owns & operates a business selling dried fish in the community. Ronielyn has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Ronielyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronielyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ronielyn is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Ronielyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: As addtional capital

location.town: Bogabongan, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro B. P. is from the village of San Miquel Liloy. He is 55 years old. Alejandro is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Alejandro owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Alejandro has been engaged in his business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alejandro joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandro has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alejandro B. P. is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the  2nd loan taken out by Alejandro B P. from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Miguel, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Chagnaadorj

texts.en: Chagnaadorj is 56 years old and lives with his wife and their two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a rented ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living in their current home for two years. Their youngest daughter attends a vocational training center. Chagnaadorj's wife operates a sewing business at their home. In 2001, Chagnaadorj started manufacturing wooden products, and his family has been very supportive of him and his business. Since Chagnaadorj started his business, the family's quality of life has improved. When the business first started, its working capital was only 50,000 tugrugs (~ 35 USD). However, as a result of his hard work and determination, the working capital of the carpentry business has grown to 300,000 tugrugs (~ 211 USD). He has been planning to expand his business in the future. Chagnaadorj is a very hardworking person and he has great communication skills. He says, “I would like to continue to grow my business so that I can help my children as they get married and eventually start families of their own.” Chagnaadorj is requesting a 600,000-tugrug loan to purchase planks for the wooden products that he manufactures.

loans.use: To purchase more wooden planks

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Mrs. Elsie L. is a PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) member. She is 40 years old and married with four children. She is from Gabunon, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a farmer and Elsie manages her pig raising business. From her business she earns approximately 4,000 a month.
  
   She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP taken from PMPC. This loan was used to invest in expanding her business so that she can earn additional income. As of now, she has a new loan of 4,000 from PMPC and this loan was used to purchase additional piglets. It is the second loan she has taken from PMPC.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Segundo

texts.en:
Segundo S., 21, is making sure that his family has enough for their daily needs. He has been managing his own variety store for quite some time now. He also rents out 6 rooms.

Segundo has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for over a year now. He regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays his weekly dues consistently. Because of his good repayment performance with previous loans, he has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  He is consistent in paying his dues because he used the money he borrowed to expand and improve his variety store.

Now, with your help, he would like to apply for a Php 19,000 loan. This amount will be used as additional capital to buy groceries to replenish stock and to maintain operation of his expanding business.

He dreams that his business will continue to grow so that he can have a good and comfortable life with his family. He also wants to have his own computer shop as he is currently doing a computer course.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to replenish stock and to maintain operation of his store.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Mrs.Emeliana B. is a PDP-LP member. She is 47 years old, married with 5 children. She is from Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a farmer. This supports their daily basic needs. She  has managed her business for almost 4 years and earns approx. 4,000 a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to be able to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 7,000 from PMPC. This loan was used to invest in expanding her business so that she could service more customers. Now she has a new loan of 10,000 from PMPC which will be used to improve her business. This is her 5th loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Josephine has been a regular member of Kiva field partner the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en: Jennifer F. is from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 40 years old and is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Jennifer is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. Jennifer plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mirzahojaeva Hosiyat`s Group

texts.ru:
Мирзабаева Феруза занимается пошивом штор и женской одежды. Работает она дома, что очень удобно, также в определенной степени снижает ее расходы. Искусству шитья она училась в УЗбекистане. Этим бизнесом она занимается на протяжении последних 9 лет. Кредит будет использован для  закупа материалов для шитья. 

Хосиятхон 46 лет. Она замужем и мать 4 дочерей, из них 2 она успела уже выдать замуж. Ее супруг находится в России на заработках. Три года назад ее супруг дома построил баню и тогда же, они начали предоставлять услуги общественной бани. Чистая прибыль в месяц составляет около 350 долларов. Кредит будет использован для ремонта помещения бани. 

Танзире 35 лет. Она проживает вместе со своей семьей: супругом и тремя детьми. Дома она занимается птицеводством, и реализацией яиц. Кредит будет использован для закуп кур, индюков, а также 200 кг кукурузы. в будущем она вместе с мужем планируют построить конюшню для содержания лошадей. 

Курбанову Дилмуроду 21 лет. Пока не женат, но собирается в скором будущем. Клиент занимается розничной торговлей фруктов на центральном рынке Араван. Этим бизнесом он начал заниматься с начала текущего года. На этот кредит он планирует закупить яблоки, бананы и грушы. Текущая чистая прибыль в месяц составляет около 150 долларов, однако он надеется что увеличение ассортимента продукции, позволит увеличить его чистую прибыль. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Feruza M. is involved in sewing window curtains and women’s clothing. She works at home, which is not only very convenient, but also reduces her expenses to some degree. She learned the art of sewing in Uzbekistan. Feruza has been involved in this business for the last 9 years. The loan will be used for the purchase of sewing materials. Hosiyathon is 46 years old. She is married and has 4 daughters, 2 of whom she already married off. Her husband currently works in Russia. He built a sauna at home three years ago, and they started offering public sauna services then. Their net profit is around 350 dollars per month. The loan will be used to make repairs to the sauna building. Tanzira is 35 years old. She lives together with her family: husband and three children. She is involved in bird husbandry and egg sales at home. The loan will be used for the purchase of chickens, turkeys and also 200 kg of corn. In the future, Tanzira and her husband plan to build a stable for keeping horses. Dilmurod K. is 21 years old. He is not yet married, but plans to be in the near future. The client is involved in retail sales of fruits at the Aravan central market. He started this business since the beginning of this year. Dilmurod plans to use this loan to purchase apples, bananas and pears. His net running profit is around 150 dollars per month; however, he hopes that expanding his product variety will allow him to increase his net profit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials

loans.name: María Beatriz

texts.es: María Beatriz Q. D. R. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en Jucuapa, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como conserje D. una escuela del lugar, y junto a su hija D. 17 años D. edad quien se dedica a estudiar y a ayudarle a su madre con los quehaceres del hogar y algunas veces con el negocio. María posee una tortillería la cual está ubicada en su propia casa. Cada día se levanta muy temprano, a lavar el maíz que posteriormente lleva al molino para formar la masa con la cual elabora las tortillas, tanto en los mediodías como en las tardes. Ella posee muchos clientes los cuales le son fieles desD. hace muchos años atrás, ya que María es una persona muy respetuosa y amable quien brida un excelente trabajo a sus clientes, lo cual los incentiva a comprar en el negocio D. ella. María solicita un préstamo a Integral, con el deseo D. poder mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio, comprando maíz por mayor, el cual le dé el  acceso para atender mayor cantidad D. clientes lo cual le permita percibir mayores ganancias, que se vean reflejadas en el bienestar D. su familia, ya que esta depenD. en gran manera D. dicho negocio.
texts.en:
María Beatriz Q. D. R., 39, lives in Jucuapa, Usulután with her husband, who works as a caretaker at a local school, and her 17-year-old daughter, who is a student and helps her mother with household chores and sometimes with her business. María makes tortillas at home. Every day she rises very early to wash the corn which she then takes to the mill to be ground into tortilla dough that she uses to make tortillas twice a day: noon and afternoon. She has many regular customers that have been loyal to her for many years because María is a very respectful and kind person who provides excellent service to her customers; this motivates them to buy from her. María is requesting funds from Integral in order to improve her business’ condition; she wants to buy corn at wholesale. This will permit her to serve more customers and thereby earn higher profits. These will be seen reflected in her family’s wellbeing since this depends, to a great extent, on this business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Melvely

texts.en:
Melvely J., 47, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Tomas J., a family driver, and the couple is blessed with two children. Melvely helps her husband earn a living so that their family can have a better life.  She has been selling assorted varieties of biscuits and breakfast fare for quite some time now.

Melvely has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends the group's weekly fellowship meetings and consistently pays her weekly dues. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow four times from CCT’s cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her food business.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use this added capital for her expanding business by buying more quantities of biscuits and buying raw ingredients for her breakfast fare.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can branch out  into other types of business.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits and raw ingredients

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en: Ma. Elena M. is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay San Juan, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living with her general store business. Ma. Elena’s husband, Danilo, works as a carpenter and as a laborer in a sugarcane plantation. They have four children who are are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Ma. Elena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000 from her business activities. Ma Elena is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 17,000 was used to fund operations for her general store which had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 17,000 as her 17th loan, which she intends to use for her general store business. Ma Elena is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en: Leny S. is a married women who supports her family with her general store, furniture business and rice retailing business. She lives in Barangay Cubay, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their two schooled children who are 13 and 16 years old. Leny has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, furniture, and rice businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 9,000. Leny is now borrowing Php 18,000 so that she can continue to be able to purchase additional inventory for her general store and her rice business. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 18,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann C., 39, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Bonifacio C., a driver, and they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been selling cosmetics through her direct-selling line of the popular cosmetics brands.

Mary Ann has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow five times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her direct-selling business.

Now, with your help, Mary Ann would like to obtain a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying advance orders of her direct-selling line.

Mary Ann dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia V. is a 58-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy 2, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by buying and selling dried fish.

Concordia’s 54-year-old husband, Mario, is also a dried fish vendor.  They have 7 children between the ages of 17 – 33 years old with 2 of them having their own family. Three are currently employed while the other 2 are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Concordia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in buying and selling dried fish. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Concordia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,500 was used to fund the operations of her dried fish business which has had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is taking out her 8th loan in the amount of Php 19,500, which she intends to use on her dried fish venture. Concordia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.
